original: nges pa la nges pa nyid du 'byed pa ni nges par 'byed pa yin la nges par 'byed pa'i phyir rab tu byung bas na nges par 'byed pa nyid de gang la yod pa de ni nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can te /ğŸ”½nges pa'i yul la khong du chud par nus pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nges pa la nges pa nyid du 'byed pa ni nges par 'byed pa yin la nges par 'byed pa'i phyir rab tu byung bas na nges par 'byed pa nyid de gang la yod pa de ni nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab can te / nges pa'i yul la khong du chud par nus pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The wisdom of definite discrimination is the wisdom of one who has definite discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of great discrimination is the wisdom of one who has great discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of extensive discrimination is the wisdom of one who has extensive discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of profound discrimination is the wisdom of one who has profound discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of definite discrimination is the wisdom of one who has definite discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of great discrimination is the wisdom of one who has great discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of extensive discrimination is the wisdom of one who has extensive discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of profound discrimination is the wisdom of one who has profound discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of definite discrimination is the wisdom of one who has definite discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of great discrimination is the wisdom of one who has great discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of extensive discrimination is the wisdom of one who has extensive discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of profound discrimination is the wisdom of one who has profound discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of definite discrimination is the wisdom of one who has definite discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of great discrimination is the wisdom of one who has great discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of extensive discrimination is the wisdom of one who has extensive discrimination.

original: yul chen po yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes rab gang la yod pa de ni shes rab che ba'o //
analyzed: yul chen po yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes rab gang la yod pa de ni shes rab che ba'o //
translated: The wisdom of profound discrimination is the wisdom of one who has profound discrimination.

original: sbyor ba la ltos pa med par yul yangs pa yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes rab gang la yod pa de ni shes rab yangs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ltos pa med par yul yangs pa yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes rab gang la yod pa de ni shes rab yangs pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of definite discrimination is the wisdom of one who has definite discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of great discrimination is the wisdom of one who has great discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of extensive discrimination is the wisdom of one who has extensive discrimination.

original: shin tu zab pa'i dngos po yongs su shes pa'i phyir shes rab zab pa yin la /ğŸ”½zab pa ni gting dpag dka' ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu zab pa'i dngos po yongs su shes pa'i phyir shes rab zab pa yin la /ğŸ”½zab pa ni gting dpag dka' ba'o //
translated: The wisdom of profound discrimination is the wisdom of one who has profound discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of definite discrimination is the wisdom of one who has definite discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of great discrimination is the wisdom of one who has great discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of extensive discrimination is the wisdom of one who has extensive discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of profound discrimination is the wisdom of one who has profound discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of definite discrimination is the wisdom of one who has definite discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of great discrimination is the wisdom of one who has great discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of extensive discrimination is the wisdom of one who has extensive discrimination.ğŸ”½The wisdom of profound discrimination is the wisdom of one who has profound discrimination.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig la yang de 'dra ba'i shes rab med pa'i phyir shes rab mtshungs pa med pa'o /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig la yang de 'dra ba'i shes rab med pa'i phyir shes rab mtshungs pa med pa'o /
translated: Because no one else has such wisdom except for the TathÄgata, his wisdom is unequaled.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa //
translated: Except for the TathÄgata,

original: 'jig rten kun gyi shes rab gang //ğŸ”½sh'a ri'i bu yi shes rab kyi //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyi shes rab gang // sh'a ri'i bu yi shes rab kyi //
translated: the wisdom of all worldsğŸ”½does not equal one-sixteenth

original: bcu drug char yang mi phod do //ğŸ”½zhes 'byung ba yin no //ğŸ”½myur bar rtogs pa las brtsams pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bcu drug char yang mi phod do // zhes 'byung ba yin no // myur bar rtogs pa las brtsams pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: of the wisdom of ÅšÄriputra.

original: shes rab de nyid rin po che yin pa dang ldan zhing 'byor pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab de nyid rin po che yin pa dang ldan zhing 'byor pa yin te /
translated: It is a jewel because it possesses the quality of quickly realizing, and it is endowed because it is endowed with that very wisdom which is a jewel.

original: rnyed par dka' ba dang / nus pa ngo mtshar che bas na rin po che'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas @77b nas so //
analyzed: rnyed par dka' ba dang / nus pa ngo mtshar che bas na rin po che'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas @77b nas so //
translated: It is a jewel because it is difficult to obtain and has the great wonder of ability.

original: mi shes pa dag go bar byed pa'i phyir yang dag par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa dag go bar byed pa'i phyir yang dag par ston pa yin te /
translated: It is a teacher because it causes the understanding of the ignorant,

original: bya ba yang dag par ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba yang dag par ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the teaching of what should be done.

original: yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems le los gnod par gyur pa yang dag par 'god pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems le los gnod par gyur pa yang dag par 'god pa ste /
translated: The mind of one who possesses full understanding is afflicted by laziness. He is established in the correct practice of virtue.

original: dge ba'i bya ba la 'god par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bya ba la 'god par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is established in the practice of virtue.

original: mos pa dman pa dag dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa la mngon par sbyor ba'i spro ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa dman pa dag dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa la mngon par sbyor ba'i spro ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'o //
translated: He encourages those who have inferior aspiration to apply themselves to superior things.

original: mos pa rgya che ba dag dang / 'bras bu chen po byed pa la spro ba skyes pa dag la 'bras bu de'i yon tan brjod pa'i sgo nas rab tu dga' bskyed pa'i phyir yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa rgya che ba dag dang / 'bras bu chen po byed pa la spro ba skyes pa dag la 'bras bu de'i yon tan brjod pa'i sgo nas rab tu dga' bskyed pa'i phyir yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: He delights those who have superior aspiration and who have generated enthusiasm for great results by speaking of the virtues of those results.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa de dag la yang rtag tu yon tan rjod par byed pa'i phyir bsngags pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa de dag la yang rtag tu yon tan rjod par byed pa'i phyir bsngags pa smra ba'o //
translated: He speaks praise of those who have done something for him, always proclaiming their good qualities.

original: 'khor rnam bzhi ni dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag go //
analyzed: 'khor rnam bzhi ni dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag go //
translated: The four assemblies are the assemblies of monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.

original: mi nus pa med do zhes bya ba la mi nus pa ni du ba pa yin la /
analyzed: mi nus pa med do zhes bya ba la mi nus pa ni du ba pa yin la /
translated: Inability is exhaustion.

original: chos bshad pa'i phyir ngag gi rab tu 'jug pa dub pa med pas na mi nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos bshad pa'i phyir ngag gi rab tu 'jug pa dub pa med pas na mi nus pa med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no exhaustion of speech in teaching the Dharma, there is no inability.

original: chos dang chos kyi longs spyod ngag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: chos dang chos kyi longs spyod ngag ces bya ba la /
translated: The Dharma and enjoyment of the Dharma are speech.

original: chos kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan yin la /
translated: The Dharma is the qualities of morality, concentration, wisdom, and so on.

original: chos kyi longs spyod ni chos kyis yang dag par rnam par 'god pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod ni chos kyis yang dag par rnam par 'god pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment of the Dharma is the correct establishment of the Dharma.

original: mya ngan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mya ngan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Sorrow, lamentation,

original: mya ngan ni sdug pa dang bral ba las skyes pa'i nang gi gdung ba'o //ğŸ”½sdug bsngal ba ni de nyid kyi rgyu can gyi lus kyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan ni sdug pa dang bral ba las skyes pa'i nang gi gdung ba'o // sdug bsngal ba ni de nyid kyi rgyu can gyi lus kyi gdung ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is internal burning born from separation from the loved one.

original: smre sngags 'don pa ni de'i rgyu can kho nas tshig tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa ni de'i rgyu can kho nas tshig tu smra ba'o //
translated: Lamentation is the verbal expression of that very cause.ğŸ”½Here, what is obtained from what?

original: 'dir de dag gang las thob pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i khyad par gang las 'di thob par gyur pa'o /
analyzed: 'dir de dag gang las thob pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i khyad par gang las 'di thob par gyur pa'o /
translated: What is the special cause from which this is obtained?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: rgyu ba dag gi skye ba la skyes pa zhes bya la //
analyzed: rgyu ba dag gi skye ba la skyes pa zhes bya la //
translated: The arising of the moving things is called birth.

original: ri la sogs pa gnas pa'i dngos po skyes par gyur pa la 'byung ba'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa gnas pa'i dngos po skyes par gyur pa la 'byung ba'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: The arising of things that are not moving, such as mountains, is called origination.

original: gtsug lag khang dang khang khyim dang / ra ba la sogs pa'i dngos po skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol las grub pa la byas pa'i sgras gsungs la /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang khang khyim dang / ra ba la sogs pa'i dngos po skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol las grub pa la byas pa'i sgras gsungs la /
translated: The arising of things that are made by the effort of a person, such as a temple, a house, a wall, etc., is called creation.

original: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen las grub pa bee d'urya dang shel la sogs pa'i rin po che mdzes par bsgrub pa'i phyir byi dor byas pa la /ğŸ”½'dus byas kyi sgras gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang rkyen las grub pa bee d'urya dang shel la sogs pa'i rin po che mdzes par bsgrub pa'i phyir byi dor byas pa la / 'dus byas kyi sgras gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The arising of things that are made of causes and conditions, such as beautiful gems, such as lapis lazuli, crystal, etc., is called manufacture.ğŸ”½The arising of things that are made by the mind, such as the body of the Buddha, etc., is called mind-made.

original: @78a * // mngon sum du sems kyis sgrub pa gang yin pa de la sems pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @78a * // mngon sum du sems kyis sgrub pa gang yin pa de la sems pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is accomplished by the mind in a direct way is called thought.

original: ji ltar lus dang ngag gi las lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lus dang ngag gi las lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the karma of body and speech.

original: rkyen de dang de'i tshogs pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: rkyen de dang de'i tshogs pa rnyed nas /
translated: When the conditions are assembled,

original: 'du ba'i rgyu las dngos po skyes pa gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /ğŸ”½dngos po de nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan par gyur pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'du ba'i rgyu las dngos po skyes pa gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste / dngos po de nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan par gyur pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Whatever entity arises from a cause is dependently originated.ğŸ”½That entity itself, which is endowed with the distinction of being dependently originated, is dependently originated.

original: 'jig pa ni nyams pa yin la de'i chos gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba gang la yod pa de ni 'jig pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni nyams pa yin la de'i chos gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba gang la yod pa de ni 'jig pa'i chos can no //
translated: Destruction is the loss of an entity. That which necessarily has the quality of destruction is subject to destruction.

original: kye ma'o de la mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kye ma'o de la mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Alas, it is not subject to destruction.

original: kye ma'i sgra ni smon pa yin te /
analyzed: kye ma'i sgra ni smon pa yin te /
translated: The word â€œalasâ€ expresses a wish.

original: 'jig par ma gyur cig ces smon pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig par ma gyur cig ces smon pa'o //
translated: The wish is that it not be subject to destruction.ğŸ”½There is no place for it.

original: 'di la gnas med do zhes bya ba ni 'di la srid pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gnas med do zhes bya ba ni 'di la srid pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It does not exist in any place.

original: sngon chad kyang zhes bya ba ni sngar ram /
analyzed: sngon chad kyang zhes bya ba ni sngar ram /
translated: It did not exist previously.ğŸ”½It did not exist before.

original: yang na 'bad pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'bad pa ste /
translated: Or, it is effort.

original: rab tu 'bad pas gnas pa la gus par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad pas gnas pa la gus par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is respect for abiding through effort.

original: bshad pa ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni gsungs pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the teaching.

original: thams cad la sdug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thams cad la sdug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: All that is dear and so on.

original: sdug pa'i sgra ni ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i sgra ni ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dod pa la bya'o //
translated: The term â€œpleasantâ€ refers to the desire for future objects such as form.

original: mdza' ba'i sgra ni da ltar gyi yul la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mdza' ba'i sgra ni da ltar gyi yul la dga' ba'o //
translated: The term â€œdearâ€ refers to the delight in present objects.

original: dga' ba'i sgra ni 'das pa'i yul la dga' ba nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i sgra ni 'das pa'i yul la dga' ba nyid la bya'o //
translated: The term â€œdelightfulâ€ refers to the delight in past objects.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i sgra ni dus thams cad du yid dang rjes su mthun par gyur pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i sgra ni dus thams cad du yid dang rjes su mthun par gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: The term â€œagreeableâ€ refers to that which is always in harmony with the mind.

original: de dag gis sna tshogs su byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa sngon du song ba nyid kyi bral ba ni sna tshogs su byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis sna tshogs su byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa sngon du song ba nyid kyi bral ba ni sna tshogs su byung ba'o //
translated: The term â€œvariousâ€ refers to the separation that occurs when the collection of causes is no longer present.

original: med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de dag med par byung ba ste /
analyzed: med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de dag med par byung ba ste /
translated: The term â€œnon-existenceâ€ refers to the occurrence of their non-existence.

original: thams cad kyis thams cad du 'jig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyis thams cad du 'jig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term â€œdestructionâ€ means that everything does not become destroyed in every way.

original: shin tu bral ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu bye bar gyur pa gang yin pa de la bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu bral ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu bye bar gyur pa gang yin pa de la bya'o //
translated: The term â€œcomplete separationâ€ refers to the complete separation that occurs.

original: dus de srid tsam du byed par gyur pa rab tu bral ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dus de srid tsam du byed par gyur pa rab tu bral ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The term â€œcomplete separationâ€ means that which occurs for a certain period of time.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Or else, it is desire because it is the object of desire.

original: 'dod par bya pa'i gzugs nyid yong pa'i phyir mdza' ba yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dod par bya pa'i gzugs nyid yong pa'i phyir mdza' ba yin zhing /
translated: It is dear because it is the form that one desires.

original: sdug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dga' ba'o //
translated: It is pleasing because it is the cause of pleasure.

original: yid kyis skad cig tsam yang mi gtong ba'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyis skad cig tsam yang mi gtong ba'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: It is attractive because one does not abandon it even for a moment.

original: de dang lhan cig yul gzhan du song ba las bral ba ni sna tshogs su 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig yul gzhan du song ba las bral ba ni sna tshogs su 'byung ba yin la /
translated: It is separation from the variety because one is separated from it when one goes to another place with it.

original: gzhan dang bral ba ni med par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang bral ba ni med par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is separation from the non-variety because one is separated from it when one is not with it.

original: shin tu bskal pa'i rgyud @78b khams gzhan du skyes pa las bral ba ni shin tu bral ba yin la /
analyzed: shin tu bskal pa'i rgyud @78b khams gzhan du skyes pa las bral ba ni shin tu bral ba yin la /
translated: It is complete separation because one is separated from it when one is born in another realm and it is very far away.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa las bral ba ni rab tu bral ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa las bral ba ni rab tu bral ba'o //
translated: It is utter separation because one is separated from it when one attains nirvana.

original: yang na lkog tu yang 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir sdug pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na lkog tu yang 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir sdug pa yin la /
translated: Or else, it is dear because one desires it in secret.ğŸ”½It is pleasing because it is the cause of pleasure.

original: dbang po thams cad mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi phyir mdza' ba yin zhing /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi phyir mdza' ba yin zhing /
translated: It is attractive because it is the cause of the delight of all the faculties.

original: skad cig ma tsam yang tha dad par gnas pas skyo bar byed pa'i phyir dga' ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma tsam yang tha dad par gnas pas skyo bar byed pa'i phyir dga' ba'o //
translated: It is delightful because it is pleasing for just a moment, and because it is painful when it ends.

original: yid kyis kun nas 'khyud cing gnas pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyis kun nas 'khyud cing gnas pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba ste /
translated: It is attractive because it is embraced by the mind and remains.

original: de dag dang lhan cig mthong ba'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa tsam gyis bral ba ni sna tshogs su 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig mthong ba'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa tsam gyis bral ba ni sna tshogs su 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The arising of variety is the mere separation from the object of enjoyment that one sees with them.

original: ldog par nus pa'i yul gzhan du song nas bral ba ni med par byung ba'o //
analyzed: ldog par nus pa'i yul gzhan du song nas bral ba ni med par byung ba'o //
translated: The arising of nonexistence is the separation from the object that one can obtain by going elsewhere.

original: yul gzhan du song ba'i sgo nas ldog par mi nus pa'i 'bral ba ni shin tu bral ba yin la //
analyzed: yul gzhan du song ba'i sgo nas ldog par mi nus pa'i 'bral ba ni shin tu bral ba yin la //
translated: The arising of complete separation is the separation from the object that one cannot obtain by going elsewhere.

original: 'chi ba las bral ba ni rab tu bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba las bral ba ni rab tu bral ba'o //
translated: The arising of complete separation is the separation from death.

original: shing chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: shing chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The great tree, etc.

original: chen po ni shin tu tshad chen por gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: chen po ni shin tu tshad chen por gyur pa yin la /
translated: Great means very large.

original: de'i rtsa ba shin tu brtan pa nyid kyi phyir rtsa ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba shin tu brtan pa nyid kyi phyir rtsa ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has roots because its roots are very firm.

original: yal ga skye ba'i phyogs las 'og tu gyur pa dang / rtsa ba'i cha las steng du gyur pa ni sdong po'i sgras bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yal ga skye ba'i phyogs las 'og tu gyur pa dang / rtsa ba'i cha las steng du gyur pa ni sdong po'i sgras bstan pa yin te /
translated: The trunk is indicated by the word â€œtrunkâ€ in the verse, which is below the direction in which the branches grow and above the root.

original: de dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir sdong po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir sdong po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is â€œendowed with a trunkâ€ because it possesses a trunk.

original: shin tu gcad par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir snying po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu gcad par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir snying po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is â€œendowed with a heartwoodâ€ because it is difficult to cut through.

original: gser la sogs pa'i ri ni rin po che'i ri yin la /
analyzed: gser la sogs pa'i ri ni rin po che'i ri yin la /
translated: A mountain of gold, etc. is a mountain of jewels.

original: rtse mo ni phung por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo ni phung por gyur pa'o //
translated: The peak is the collection.

original: shin tu mtho ba'i 'dab ma lhags pa'i phyir dang / ri'i rtse mo rnyil ba'i phyir shing dang / ri de bzhin du yun ring po gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu mtho ba'i 'dab ma lhags pa'i phyir dang / ri'i rtse mo rnyil ba'i phyir shing dang / ri de bzhin du yun ring po gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The tree and the mountain are like that, because the high branches are broken off and the peak of the mountain is destroyed, they do not last for a long time.

analyzed: dge tshul gyi phyir nye bar gzhag pa ni rab tu byung ba gzhan la klog pa dang / 'don pa la sogs pas phan pa la nye bar 'god pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the novice monk is the establishment of the other ordained monks in the benefit of reading, reciting, etc.

original: ji ltar 'don pa zhes bya ba ni khyod ji ltar gzhung 'don pa de gzhan la gzhung gi sgo nas klog tu gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'don pa zhes bya ba ni khyod ji ltar gzhung 'don pa de gzhan la gzhung gi sgo nas klog tu gzhug pa'o //

original: 'dzin du 'jug pa ni don gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'dzin du 'jug pa ni don gyi sgo nas so //
translated: One should cause to retain by means of the meaning.

original: slob tu gzhug pa ni bya ba ma yin pa las zlog pa dang / bya ba la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: slob tu gzhug pa ni bya ba ma yin pa las zlog pa dang / bya ba la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //

original: bla ma'i gnas ni khyim na gnas pa'i phu bo yin la /
analyzed: bla ma'i gnas ni khyim na gnas pa'i phu bo yin la /
translated: The position of the guru is the elder brother who lives at home.

original: rab tu byung ba dag gi yang bslab pas rgan pa dang mkhan po @80b gcig la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dag gi yang bslab pas rgan pa dang mkhan po @80b gcig la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: And the ordained monks who are senior in training and the preceptor who is helpful.

original: ma bcag pa zhes bya ba ni sun ma phyung ba dang / ma bsal ba'o //
analyzed: ma bcag pa zhes bya ba ni sun ma phyung ba dang / ma bsal ba'o //

original: khang bzangs zhes bya ba ni khyim bzang po ste /
analyzed: khang bzangs zhes bya ba ni khyim bzang po ste /

original: de rab tu mtho ba'i gnas der ro //
analyzed: de rab tu mtho ba'i gnas der ro //

analyzed: dri ni gos la bsgos pa'i //

original: phreng ba ni me tog gi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: phreng ba ni me tog gi phreng ba'o //

original: mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur blangs zhes bya ba ni mchod ba'i rgyu can dri la sogs pa de blangs shing bzung nas dul bar gnas shing des 'di la bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes sems kyis bsams nas bsnyen bkur bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur blangs zhes bya ba ni mchod ba'i rgyu can dri la sogs pa de blangs shing bzung nas dul bar gnas shing des 'di la bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes sems kyis bsams nas bsnyen bkur bya ba bstan to //
translated: Having accepted worship and service means that, having accepted and taken hold of those perfumes, etc. which are the cause of worship, one should be disciplined and abide in that, and having mentally reflected, â€œBy this, I will serve,â€ one should demonstrate service.

original: go rims bzhin du srog shing la 'phang lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang po ni tshad chen por bya zhing gnyis pa ni de las cung zhig gis chud ba yin la gsum pa dang bzhi pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du srog shing la 'phang lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang po ni tshad chen por bya zhing gnyis pa ni de las cung zhig gis chud ba yin la gsum pa dang bzhi pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: In order, the axle, wheel, etc. The first is made very large, and the second is slightly smaller than that, and the third and fourth are also like that.

original: rim pa ltar 'phang lo zlum por bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa ltar 'phang lo zlum por bya'o //
translated: The wheel should be made round.

original: char las skyob pa'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir gdugs yin te /
analyzed: char las skyob pa'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir gdugs yin te /
translated: It is an umbrella because it is a means of protection from the rain.

original: thams cad kyi steng du gzhag par bya ba rdzas kyi bye brag gi rnam pa kun nas zlum pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi steng du gzhag par bya ba rdzas kyi bye brag gi rnam pa kun nas zlum pa'o //

original: so sor skye bo dag nyes pa med pa nyid kyis dge ba de nyid kyi phyir dge ba can te /
analyzed: so sor skye bo dag nyes pa med pa nyid kyis dge ba de nyid kyi phyir dge ba can te /
translated: The word â€œordinaryâ€ means that they are not spiritual trainees.

original: nyis byas can gyi kha na ma tho ba yang mi byed pa gang yin ba de la so so'i skye bo dge ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyis byas can gyi kha na ma tho ba yang mi byed pa gang yin ba de la so so'i skye bo dge ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: The word â€œvirtuousâ€ means that they are virtuous because they are not guilty of any offense.

original: byi bo zhes bya ba ni rgyan dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: byi bo zhes bya ba ni rgyan dang bral ba'o //
translated: The word â€œfreeâ€ means that they are free of ornaments.ğŸ”½The word â€œas they areâ€ means that they are just as they are.

analyzed: ji ltar bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin la de dag gi yang ji ltar de gnyis gral rim gyis 'dug par gyur pa de bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rten yang bya'o // bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs su sh'a ri'i bu 'dug par gyur la /
translated: The word â€œto the rightâ€ means that they are to the right of the Blessed One.

original: g-yon phyogs su ni mood gal gyi bu zhes rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon phyogs su ni mood gal gyi bu zhes rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: The word â€œto the leftâ€ means that they are to the left of the Blessed One.

original: shin tu yid ches par gyis shig ces bya ba ni yid brtan pas so //
analyzed: shin tu yid ches par gyis shig ces bya ba ni yid brtan pas so //
translated: The word â€œbelieveâ€ means that they have faith.

original: gru bo che legs te zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gru bo che legs te zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: The word â€œwellâ€ means that they are well.

original: 'gro bar byed pa'i don gyis na theg pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pa'i don gyis na theg pa yin la /
translated: It is a vehicle because it conveys one to the other shore.

analyzed: sbyin pa ni rjes su gzung ba'i don la /

analyzed: bsod nams ni mchod pa'i don yin ba'am /

analyzed: sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i rang bzhin yin la /

analyzed: bsod nams ni tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin yin no //

translated: That which is to be beaten is suitable to be beaten.ğŸ”½The shade of the Jambu tree is the first meditative concentration of the Bodhisattva, which is similar to the uncontaminated state.

analyzed: dpa'i lus ci 'dra ba de'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun par byas pa'i sku gzugs so //

original: smad par blta bas na zhes bya bar lta ba ste /

original: skem pa ni sha yongs su zad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skem pa ni sha yongs su zad par gyur pa'o //

original: rid pa ni bya ba byed pa'i nus pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: rid pa ni bya ba byed pa'i nus pa chung ba'o //

original: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni gzi dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni gzi dang bral bar gyur pa'o //

original: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin grub pa yin la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin grub pa yin la /

original: yid la byed pa ni ma grub pa yin zhing mi byed pa ni yongs su dor bar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: ma brjed pa la dran par byed pa zhes bstan to //

analyzed: skabs 'byed pa ni ltung ba gleng ba'i skabs 'byed par byed pa'o //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das b'a r'a na s'i na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon par tshangs pa chen pos gsol ba btab ste /

original: chos bstan par zhal gyis bzhes par mkhyen nas kun nas 'tsho byed kyi mdun du b'a r'a na s'ir gshegs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ste /

translated: The turning of the wheel of the Dharma here refers to the Buddhaâ€™s assent to teach the Dharma, which he gave in response to the request of Great Brahma.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas brtas pa'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'joms par byed pa'i mdo sde 'di gsungs pa yin la /

analyzed: de la bskal pa grangs med pa gsum dang bgrang bar shin tu dka' ba brgyas bsgrubs pa'i chos kyi gter chen po yin te /

analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis 'jig tshogs su lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs drungs ma phyung bar kun du sbyor ba thams cad yongs su zad cing spangs pa'i shes pa thob par mi 'gyur ro // de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde sngon gyi skye bar goms pa'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs ma lus par zad par bya ba'i phyir dad pa mchog la
translated: Disciples do not obtain the knowledge of the complete abandonment of all fetters without uprooting the mass of afflictions such as the afflicted view of the self.

original: sogs pa skyes pa dag la brtsams nas mdo sde 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa skyes pa dag la brtsams nas mdo sde 'di gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One, having begun with the five ascetics, for whom the roots of virtue conducive to liberation had matured through prior habituation, spoke this discourse in order that the mass of afflictions abandoned by seeing might be completely exhausted.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ston pa'o //

analyzed: b'a r'a na s'i de dang thag mi ring ba na yong pa'i khang khyer de la b'a r'a na s'i na zhes bya ste /
translated: Not far from that VÄrÄá¹‡asÄ«, in the city called Approaching, it is called VÄrÄá¹‡asÄ«.

original: thag nye ba dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: thag nye ba dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: It is a nearby place, under its power.

analyzed: bzhugs te zhes bya ba la ste'i sgra ni 'das pa'i dus nyid ston par byed pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ltar bzhugs pa dang gzims pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa yod pa de lta na yang 'dir bzhugs pa tsam la bya ste /

analyzed: de la bzhugs na sa mdo sde 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: de dag gang du chos gsungs bar mdzad pa de ni drang srong smra ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: The place called the abode of the sages is where the sages, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, teach the Dharma.

analyzed: bar mdzad pa'o //

original: ri dags rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni ri dags dag yid brtan pas spyod cing gnas pa'i don du rgyal pos sa phyogs de btang ba'i phyir ri dags rgyu ba zhes bya'o //

translated: The phrase the deer park means that the king gave that place to the deer so that they could live and move about with confidence.

translated: Since the three revolutions are mentioned in twelve aspects, the paths of seeing, cultivation and no learning are to be understood as being referred to here.ğŸ”½The path of seeing should be understood as the revolution of the view that this is suffering, this is the origin, this is the cessation, this is the path, in order to fully understand the nature of suffering, origin, cessation and path.

original: kun 'byung spang bar bya /

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya /

original: lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bskor ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bskor ba 'di yin te /

analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la sdug bsngal ni shes so //

original: kun 'byung ni spangs so //

original: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du byas so //

original: lam ni bsgoms so zhes bskor ba 'di yin par rig par bya ste /

original: gang gi phyir bag la nyal ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir der gnas pa dag la bden pa yang mngon sum du bya ba dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //

original: lam thams cad kyi thog mar rtsol ba @84a * //
analyzed: lam thams cad kyi thog mar rtsol ba @84a * //

translated: the wheel of Dharma is turned three times on the path of seeing, with twelve aspects.ğŸ”½In the phrase â€œI have turned the wheel of Dharma,â€ the word â€œgodsâ€ is used because gods are the most important among humans.

analyzed: mdor bsdu ba nyid kyi ni skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la legs pa ni skabs sbyin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la legs pa ni skabs sbyin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word â€œproperlyâ€ means that the Buddha was dwelling in the grove at the proper time.

original: rab tu bzung ba ni thos pa mi brjod pa yin pa'i phyir @85b ro ;
analyzed: rab tu bzung ba ni thos pa mi brjod pa yin pa'i phyir @85b ro ;
translated: It is well-grasped because it does not forget what it has learned.

original: / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is attention because it is the source of proper mental attention.

original: rung ba ma yin ba bsten la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin ba bsten la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œ Relying on what is improperâ€

original: rung ba ma yin pa'i phyogs sten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa'i phyogs sten par byed pa'o //
translated: means relying on a side that is not proper.

original: rung ba spong na zhes bya ba ni rung ba dang lhan cig 'gal bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rung ba spong na zhes bya ba ni rung ba dang lhan cig 'gal bar gyur pa ste /
translated: â€œ Rejecting what is properâ€ means being in opposition to what is proper.

original: de lhag par spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lhag par spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: That should not be practiced excessively.

original: rung ba bsten la zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i phyogs bsten pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa dang 'gal ba de ni lhag par spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rung ba bsten la zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i phyogs bsten pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa dang 'gal ba de ni lhag par spyad par bya'o //
translated: â€œ Relying on what is properâ€ means relying on a side that is proper and not improper. That should be practiced excessively.

original: ji ltar khri rkang pa spras pa can gyi gzhi nyid du gyur pa la bshad ba dang gci ba mi bya ba nyid dang / longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i dgag ba yod cing gang tshva dang 'dres pa'i rgyun chu btung bar bya ba nyid dang /
analyzed: ji ltar khri rkang pa spras pa can gyi gzhi nyid du gyur pa la bshad ba dang gci ba mi bya ba nyid dang / longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i dgag ba yod cing gang tshva dang 'dres pa'i rgyun chu btung bar bya ba nyid dang /
translated: And it is permitted to drink the stream that is mixed with beer, but it is not permitted to eat from a broken bowl, and so on.

original: kham phor la bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i gnang ba yod pa de thams cad ni 'dis grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kham phor la bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i gnang ba yod pa de thams cad ni 'dis grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: All of these are established by this.

original: de skad du gang bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bkag la mi rung ba bsten pa de ni 'dis dgag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de skad du gang bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bkag la mi rung ba bsten pa de ni 'dis dgag par bya ba yin la /
translated: The BhagavÄn did not prohibit the use of what is unsuitable, and that is to be prohibited by this.

original: gang yang rjes su gnang ba med la rung ba bsten pa de ni 'dis rjes su gnang ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rjes su gnang ba med la rung ba bsten pa de ni 'dis rjes su gnang ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And that which is not permitted but is suitable to use is to be permitted by this.

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'dor ba ni spangs pa yin la spang ba'i phyir nus pa yin bas na spangs pa ste /
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'dor ba ni spangs pa yin la spang ba'i phyir nus pa yin bas na spangs pa ste /
translated: Abandonment is the relinquishing of something. The one who is able to abandon is the one who has abandoned.

original: yongs su dor ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //ğŸ”½rdzas la nges par spyod pas dge skos te /
analyzed: yongs su dor ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o // rdzas la nges par spyod pas dge skos te /
translated: The same applies up to the one who has completely relinquished.ğŸ”½The one who is in charge of the monastery is the one who is in charge of the monastery.

original: gang gtsug lag khang du dge 'dun mngon par gyes nas las su bya ba sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gtsug lag khang du dge 'dun mngon par gyes nas las su bya ba sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is in charge of the monastery is the one who, when the Saá¹…gha has split in the monastery, accomplishes the work.

original: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni cung zhig kyang yongs su shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni cung zhig kyang yongs su shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: The one who is ignorant is the one who does not have even a little bit of the conception of complete understanding.

original: yongs su sgo shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su sgo shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: The one who is in charge of the monastery should say, â€œCompletely give it up.â€

original: 'di ltar chos gos 'di phyir yang de la byin cig ces shes par gyis shig pa'o //ğŸ”½shu ba ni rma'i then kor gyi khrag skams kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gos 'di phyir yang de la byin cig ces shes par gyis shig pa'o // shu ba ni rma'i then kor gyi khrag skams kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: You should understand that it should be given back to him.ğŸ”½A scab is a collection of dried blood from a wound.

original: sbrang bu bskyab pa'i phyir gos la byas pa can ni spang skyabs so //
analyzed: sbrang bu bskyab pa'i phyir gos la byas pa can ni spang skyabs so //
translated: A patch is a piece of cloth that is sewn onto a robe in order to protect it from being eaten by insects.

original: lhag ma med par byas nas zhes bya ba ni zheng chung dus byas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma med par byas nas zhes bya ba ni zheng chung dus byas pa'o //
translated: Having made it without excess means having made it with a small width.

original: drang por byas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par gsal ba dang mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: drang por byas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par gsal ba dang mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: â€œIn a straight lineâ€ means in a clear and direct way.

original: snol ma zhes bya ba ni ras snol mar sbyar ba'o //ğŸ”½dal bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni chu tshags 'debs par gyur pas so //
analyzed: snol ma zhes bya ba ni ras snol mar sbyar ba'o // dal bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni chu tshags 'debs par gyur pas so //
translated: â€œIn a crisscross patternâ€ means in a way that is interwoven.ğŸ”½â€œHaving become tiredâ€ means having become exhausted from carrying the water strainer.

original: chu blang bar bsams pa dang zhes bya ba ni chu tshags kyi sbyor ba'i sgo nas len par bsams par gyur pa dang / 'dzin pa'i snod ni chu tshags las @86a * //
analyzed: chu blang bar bsams pa dang zhes bya ba ni chu tshags kyi sbyor ba'i sgo nas len par bsams par gyur pa dang / 'dzin pa'i snod ni chu tshags las @86a * //
translated: â€œHaving thought to take up the waterâ€ means having thought to take up the water by means of the strainer.

original: phyi rol du gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du gdags par bya'o //
translated: The vessel for holding the water should be placed outside the water strainer.

original: mi chags pa ni 'dzin par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mi chags pa ni 'dzin par mi nus pa'o //
translated: â€œNot stickingâ€ means that the water does not adhere to it.

original: ngal bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dran pa rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba dang / lus gdung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ngal bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dran pa rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba dang / lus gdung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: â€œHaving become tiredâ€ means that their mindfulness has been impaired and their bodies have become exhausted.

original: grol bar byed pa'i snod ces bya ba ni gang snod bkang bas 'dzud par byed la stong pa yang dag par 'byin par byed pa'i snod la grol par byed pa'i snod du 'dod de /
analyzed: grol bar byed pa'i snod ces bya ba ni gang snod bkang bas 'dzud par byed la stong pa yang dag par 'byin par byed pa'i snod la grol par byed pa'i snod du 'dod de /
translated: â€œThe vessel for releasingâ€ is the vessel that is filled with water and then emptied.

original: de ltar gyur pa la kha dang zhabs su srad bu gnyis btags pas gzhug par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa la kha dang zhabs su srad bu gnyis btags pas gzhug par bya ba yin te /
translated: The two strings are attached to the mouth and the base of the water-pot.

original: chus khyab par gyur pa na kha la btags pa'i srad bu klong par bya zhing zhabs la btags pa'i srad bu dal gyis steng du drangs pa gang yin pa de kha 'og tu bltas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chus khyab par gyur pa na kha la btags pa'i srad bu klong par bya zhing zhabs la btags pa'i srad bu dal gyis steng du drangs pa gang yin pa de kha 'og tu bltas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the water-pot is filled with water, the string attached to the mouth is pulled and the string attached to the base is slowly drawn upwards.

original: grol bar byed pa chu'i nang du lan gsum mam lan gnyis su bkru bar bya ste /
analyzed: grol bar byed pa chu'i nang du lan gsum mam lan gnyis su bkru bar bya ste /
translated: The water-pot is freed by turning it over three or two times in the water.

original: grol bar byed pa'i snod gsungs pa las de dag thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol bar byed pa'i snod gsungs pa las de dag thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the water-pots are obtained from the water-pot that is said to be the liberator.

original: 'dis chu sgrog par byed pa'am 'di la chu sgrog par byed cing 'gro ba dang ltung ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir sgra sgrog go //
analyzed: 'dis chu sgrog par byed pa'am 'di la chu sgrog par byed cing 'gro ba dang ltung ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir sgra sgrog go //
translated: It is a water-pot because water is held in it, or it is a water-pot because water is held in it and it goes, falls and enters.

original: bum pa'i tshul du byas la zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi dbyibs gang la yod pa de ni bum pa'i tshul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa'i tshul du byas la zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi dbyibs gang la yod pa de ni bum pa'i tshul du byas pa'o //
translated: It is made in the form of a water-pot. It has the shape of the nature of a water-pot.

original: padma'i snying po ni lte ba yin te /
analyzed: padma'i snying po ni lte ba yin te /
translated: The center of the lotus is the navel.

original: lte ba ji lta ba de bzhin du sgra sgrog gi dbus la bug pa mang po can zlum la mtho ba bya'o ;
analyzed: lte ba ji lta ba de bzhin du sgra sgrog gi dbus la bug pa mang po can zlum la mtho ba bya'o ;
translated: Just like the navel, in the middle of the sound-making, there should be a many-holed round mound.

original: / de'i steng du bu gu chen po zhes bya ba la bu gu chen po ni 'dir bum pa'i kha la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: / de'i steng du bu gu chen po zhes bya ba la bu gu chen po ni 'dir bum pa'i kha la blta bar bya'o //
translated: Above that, there is the so-called large hole. Here, the large hole should be made facing the mouth of the pot.

original: bug pa la zhugs pa'i chu bsdu bar bya ba'i don du'o ga tu lce'u gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: bug pa la zhugs pa'i chu bsdu bar bya ba'i don du'o ga tu lce'u gdags par bya'o //
translated: In order to collect the water that enters the hole, a spout should be attached.

original: 'di ltar blo mthun pa sngon du zhes bya ba ni sra brkyang gi gzhi las gal te chos gos gsum po ma rnyed par gyur pa de'i tshe thams cad gding par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar blo mthun pa sngon du zhes bya ba ni sra brkyang gi gzhi las gal te chos gos gsum po ma rnyed par gyur pa de'i tshe thams cad gding par bya ste /
translated: Thus, having first agreed, means that if the three robes are not obtained from the basis of the proclamation of the kathina privileges, then all should spread the kathina.

original: dge 'dun ni tshogs du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / chos gos gsum ji tsam pa de tsam kho na'i gtan pa bting ba 'dir shes par bya bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni tshogs du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / chos gos gsum ji tsam pa de tsam kho na'i gtan pa bting ba 'dir shes par bya bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Because the Saá¹…gha is a multitude, it should be understood that the kathina is spread only for as many as there are three robes.

original: rnam par bgo ba'i chos gos bgo bar bya ba kho na yin bas na bgo bar bya'o ;
analyzed: rnam par bgo ba'i chos gos bgo bar bya ba kho na yin bas na bgo bar bya'o ;
translated: It is to be worn because it is the Dharma robe that is to be worn.

original: /'chi ba'i mthar gyur pas na 'chi mtha' can no //
analyzed: /'chi ba'i mthar gyur pas na 'chi mtha' can no //
translated: It has death as its end because it ends in death.

original: bsags pa kun gyi mtha' zad cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'tsho ba yo byad 'tshog chas dang bcas pa 'jig pa'i mtha' tsam yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: bsags pa kun gyi mtha' zad cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'tsho ba yo byad 'tshog chas dang bcas pa 'jig pa'i mtha' tsam yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the summary is that the end of life and the end of the collection of provisions are the end of destruction.

original: bsags pa zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa'i @86b gter gyi tshogs yin la /
analyzed: bsags pa zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa'i @86b gter gyi tshogs yin la /
translated: The collection is a hoard of gold, etc.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: All means without exception.

original: zad pa'i mtha' gang la yod pa de ni mtha' zad pa ste /
analyzed: zad pa'i mtha' gang la yod pa de ni mtha' zad pa ste /
translated: That which has an end of destruction is one that ends in destruction.

original: nyams pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i mthar phyin ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyams pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i mthar phyin ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is one that ends in decline and ends in separation.

original: mtha' ltung 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' ltung 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: It is one that ends in a fall, because it ends in a fall.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: mthon po kun gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthon po kun gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is all that is high.

original: yang dag pa'i go rims kyis mthon por brtsams pa'i khang pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i go rims kyis mthon por brtsams pa'i khang pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: a house built high with a proper sequence.

original: gzhan dag ni lus la mthon po kun zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni lus la mthon po kun zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: â€œhighâ€ means â€œon the body.â€

original: lus yang dag par btang ba ni lha'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: lus yang dag par btang ba ni lha'i phyir ma yin /
translated: â€œNot for the sake of the godsâ€ means not for the sake of the body.

original: longs spyod kyi phyir ma yin zhes smon lam gyi tshig dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: longs spyod kyi phyir ma yin zhes smon lam gyi tshig dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: â€œNot for the sake of wealthâ€ means not for the sake of possessions.

original: /'du ba zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i skye bo yang dag par tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'du ba zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i skye bo yang dag par tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œAssemblyâ€ means a gathering of people who eat together.

original: mthar ni 'bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i sgo nas brlag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mthar ni 'bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i sgo nas brlag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: â€œIn the end, it will be destroyedâ€ means it will be destroyed by separation.

original: mthar 'chi ba yin zhes bya ba ni mtha' mar 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mthar 'chi ba yin zhes bya ba ni mtha' mar 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: â€œIn the end, it is deathâ€ means it will end in death.

original: yang gi sgra ni gang 'dir sngar smos pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni gang 'dir sngar smos pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ means not only what was mentioned before,

original: 'on kyang srog kyang zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang srog kyang zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: but also life.

original: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba yang yin pas 'di thams cad du ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba yang yin pas 'di thams cad du ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ is used to indicate that all of these are to be applied as appropriate.

original: mtha' zad pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' zad pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the phrase â€œthe exhaustion of the endâ€ and so on are to be applied.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: smras pa / 'tsho ba ste srog go //
analyzed: smras pa / 'tsho ba ste srog go //
translated: It is life, that is, the life force.

original: de'i phyir gang longs spyad par bya ba gter bsags pa dang / gang du longs spyad par bya ba'i khyim dang / gang gis longs spyod par byed pa lus dang gang dang lhan cig longs spyod pa pha dang / ma dang bu dang / chung ma la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang longs spyad par bya ba gter bsags pa dang / gang du longs spyad par bya ba'i khyim dang / gang gis longs spyod par byed pa lus dang gang dang lhan cig longs spyod pa pha dang / ma dang bu dang / chung ma la sogs pa dang /
translated: Therefore, all of these are destroyed in the end: the treasure that is accumulated for enjoyment, the house in which one enjoys it, the body by which one enjoys it, and those with whom one enjoys itâ€”father, mother, children, wife, and so on.

original: gang gi don du longs spyod pa srog gi phyir yin pa de dag thams cad mthar 'jig pa yin no //ğŸ”½zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du longs spyod pa srog gi phyir yin pa de dag thams cad mthar 'jig pa yin no //ğŸ”½zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: And the life for the sake of which one enjoys it.

original: longs spyod bsags pa dang khyim dang lus dang chung ma la 'tsho bas rgyags pa'i dregs pa de spang bar bya ba'i phyir de skad du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod bsags pa dang khyim dang lus dang chung ma la 'tsho bas rgyags pa'i dregs pa de spang bar bya ba'i phyir de skad du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught in order to abandon the pride of being intoxicated with the enjoyment of wealth, home, body, and wife.

original: dus ni tha ma'i dus yin te /
analyzed: dus ni tha ma'i dus yin te /
translated: Time is the final time.

original: chos na gdon mi za bar 'gyur pa gang yin ba de dus kyi chos de 'chi ba yin no //
analyzed: chos na gdon mi za bar 'gyur pa gang yin ba de dus kyi chos de 'chi ba yin no //
translated: That which is certainly to be done in the Dharma is the Dharma of time, which is death.

original: de dang yang dag par ldan par gyur pa'o /
analyzed: de dang yang dag par ldan par gyur pa'o /
translated: One is endowed with that.

original: shing kyi cho ga ni dad pas rjes su sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shing kyi cho ga ni dad pas rjes su sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ritual of the tree is faith, generosity, and so on.

original: nang gi skye bo zhes bya ba ni nges par khyim na gnas pa'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: nang gi skye bo zhes bya ba ni nges par khyim na gnas pa'i skye bo'o //
translated: The inner people are definitely the people living in the home.

original: dka' ba bya bar nus pa yin pa'i phyir dka' ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: dka' ba bya bar nus pa yin pa'i phyir dka' ba byed pa ste /
translated: Because one is able to do what is difficult, one does what is difficult.
That

original: ni 'dir bdag la mi slu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ni 'dir bdag la mi slu bar byed pa'o //
translated: is what is done for oneself here.

original: lus 'di de gnyis kyis bsgrubs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di de gnyis kyis bsgrubs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bskyod pa'o //
translated: Because this body is accomplished by those two, it is shaken.

original: gsos pa ni nang gi phan 'dogs par byed pa bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gsos pa ni nang gi phan 'dogs par byed pa bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pas so //
translated: It is nourished by inner benefactors with food, drink, and so on.

original: bsrings ba ni phyi rol gyi rnam par 'che ba las bsrungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsrings ba ni phyi rol gyi rnam par 'che ba las bsrungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œExtendingâ€ means protecting from external disturbances.

original: khyer ba ni bteg pa'o //
analyzed: khyer ba ni bteg pa'o //
translated: â€œBearingâ€ means lifting up.

original: sa chen po zhes bya ba ni gling bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sa chen po zhes bya ba ni gling bzhi pa'o //
translated: â€œGreat earthâ€ means the four continents.

original: nor bu ni snang ba'i bdag nyid can dug 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu ni snang ba'i bdag nyid can dug 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: â€œGemâ€ means a jewel that has the nature of light and destroys poison.

original: man shel ni rin po che'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: man shel ni rin po che'i khyad par yin te /
translated: â€œCrystalâ€ is a particular kind of jewel.

original: khyim gang na yod pa der 'byor pa thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½rin po che dmar po zhes bya ba ni padma r'a ga yin no //
analyzed: khyim gang na yod pa der 'byor pa thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro // rin po che dmar po zhes bya ba ni padma r'a ga yin no //
translated: Wherever it is, all wealth increases there.ğŸ”½â€œRed jewelâ€ means ruby.

original: g-yas su 'khyil pa ni rin po che'i bye brag yin te /
analyzed: g-yas su 'khyil pa ni rin po che'i bye brag yin te /
translated: â€œCoiling to the rightâ€ is a particular kind of jewel.

original: gang na de yod pa der dpal 'byor pa la rtag tu gnas par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½byas pa zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang na de yod pa der dpal 'byor pa la rtag tu gnas par 'gyur ro // byas pa zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Wherever it is, there is always prosperity.ğŸ”½â€œBeneficialâ€ means helpful.

original: rab tu byas pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu phan btags pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byas pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu phan btags pa'o //
translated: â€œVery beneficialâ€ means very helpful.

original: dad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la mchod par yid ches pa'i dad pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la mchod par yid ches pa'i dad pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Lack of faith should be understood as the absence of faith in the connection between action and result, in dependent origination, and in the worship of the Three Jewels.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni tshul khrims rgud par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni tshul khrims rgud par gyur pa ste /
translated: Bad morality is the degeneration of morality.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa lnga po dag las ldog pa med pa'o//
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa lnga po dag las ldog pa med pa'o//
translated: It is the absence of turning away from the five actions of killing, etc.

original: dngos po 'di bdag gi las gzhan gyir ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni ser sna yin la /
analyzed: dngos po 'di bdag gi las gzhan gyir ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni ser sna yin la /
translated: Avarice is the thought, May this thing not be for another, but for me alone.

original: de 'di la yod pa'i phyir ser sna yin no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa'i phyir ser sna yin no //
translated: Because it exists in this person, he is called avaricious.

original: shes rab 'chal pa zhes bya ba ni blo dman par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa zhes bya ba ni blo dman par gyur pa'o //
translated: Bad wisdom is the degeneration of wisdom.

original: pha dang ma dad pa med pa dad pa phun sum tshogs pa la ste /
analyzed: pha dang ma dad pa med pa dad pa phun sum tshogs pa la ste /
translated: The lack of faith in one's father and mother is the lack of faith in those who are perfect in faith.ğŸ”½The lack of faith in those who are perfect in faith is the lack of faith in the Three Jewels. The lack of faith in the Three Jewels is the lack of faith in action and its result. The lack of faith in action and its result is the lack of faith in dependent origination. The lack of faith in dependent origination is the lack of faith in the Dharma. The lack of faith in the Dharma is the lack of faith in the community. The lack of faith in the community is the lack of faith in the Buddha. The lack of faith in the Buddha is the lack of faith in the Three Jewels.

original: dad pa'i 'byor pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba tshul khrims kyi 'byor ba dang / ser sna can gtong ba'i 'byor ba ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i 'byor pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba tshul khrims kyi 'byor ba dang / ser sna can gtong ba'i 'byor ba ste /
translated: The degeneration of morality is the absence of the morality of the vow. The absence of the morality of the vow is the absence of the morality of collecting wholesome factors. The absence of the morality of collecting wholesome factors is the absence of the morality of working for the welfare of beings. The absence of the morality of working for the welfare of beings is the degeneration of morality.ğŸ”½The absence of generosity is the absence of the generosity of giving material things. The absence of the generosity of giving material things is the absence of the generosity of giving the Dharma. The absence of the generosity of giving the Dharma is the absence of the generosity of fearlessness. The absence of the generosity of fearlessness is the absence of the generosity of giving the Dharma and material things. The absence of the generosity of giving the Dharma and material things is the absence of generosity.

original: gtong ba'i 'byor pa yang rdzas su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid can dang / 'khor ba yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid can rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gtong ba'i 'byor pa yang rdzas su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid can dang / 'khor ba yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid can rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: The wealth of generosity is twofold: the characteristic of giving material goods and the characteristic of giving up samsara.

original: shes rab 'chal ba shes rab la 'god pa shes rab phun sum tshogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba shes rab la 'god pa shes rab phun sum tshogs pa la bya ste /
translated: The wealth of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom, which is the establishment of those who are lacking in wisdom in the perfection of wisdom.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi rdzas skyed par byed pa la'o //ğŸ”½yang dag 'god par byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa la rab tu 'jug par byed 'phen par byed ces bya ba'i bar du'o //

translated: It is the generation of the substance of wisdom that is superior.ğŸ”½The wealth of correct placement is the engagement in the perfection of faith, etc.ğŸ”½The wealth of discipline is the training in the perfection of faith, etc., just as it is to be done.

original: 'dul bar byed ces bya ba ni ji @87b ltar dad pa phun sum tshogs pa las su bya ba yin pa de bzhin du slob par byed pa'o //ğŸ”½nges par 'jug par byed ces bya ba ni brtan por rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //

translated: The wealth of definite entry is the firm engagement in the perfection of faith, etc.

analyzed: so sor 'jog par byed ces bya ba ni mthar phyin thob par byed pa'o //

analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi yul la ltos pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: â€œMonastics are without dependenceâ€ means
