original: byang chub sems dpa' ste mngon par sems pa gang la yod pa de ni sems dpa' yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ste mngon par sems pa gang la yod pa de ni sems dpa' yin la /
translated: The sandals with a covering for the whole body

original: byang chub ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: byang chub ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Enlightenment is the knowledge of extinction and non-arising and the knowledge of the all-knowing.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das yin no //
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das yin no //
translated: He is the Blessed One because he has conquered the four demons.

original: ji ltar yang byang chub sems dpas bdud bzhi po bcom pa med pa de lta na yang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub dang thag nye ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la bcom ldan 'das zhes gcigğŸ”½tu tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yang byang chub sems dpas bdud bzhi po bcom pa med pa de lta na yang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'di nyid byang chub sems dpar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub dang thag nye ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la bcom ldan 'das zhes gcig tu tha snyad du byas pa yin no //
translated: Although the Bodhisattva has not yet conquered the four demons, still, because he is the Bodhisattva Sakyamuni, who has become the Blessed One, he is called the Blessed One, because he is close to enlightenment.

original: gzigs pa rnam pa lngas zhes bya ba ni rus dang / rigs dang / yul dang / rgyud dang / bud med la gzigs par 'chad par 'gyur ba dag gis so //
analyzed: gzigs pa rnam pa lngas zhes bya ba ni rus dang / rigs dang / yul dang / rgyud dang / bud med la gzigs par 'chad par 'gyur ba dag gis so //
translated: He is the Blessed One because he has seen with his five kinds of vision, which are the vision of the bones, the vision of the family, the vision of the country, the vision of the lineage, and the vision of the woman, as will be explained.

original: lan gsum yongs su sbyang ba byas nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug po dag lan gsum gyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar byas pa ste sbyang ba byas pa dang rung ba nyid du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: lan gsum yongs su sbyang ba byas nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug po dag lan gsum gyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar byas pa ste sbyang ba byas pa dang rung ba nyid du byas pa yin no //
translated: Having thoroughly purified them three times means that the six gods of the desire realm have been thoroughly purified up to three times, that is, they have been purified and made fit.

original: byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i nus pa dang de'i rjes su 'jug pa yongs su byang chub pa'i snod du rung bar mdzad pa yin gyi gzugs na spyod pa'i lha dag ni bden pa'i snod ma yin pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ma mthong ba'i phyir yongs su sbyang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i nus pa dang de'i rjes su 'jug pa yongs su byang chub pa'i snod du rung bar mdzad pa yin gyi gzugs na spyod pa'i lha dag ni bden pa'i snod ma yin pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ma mthong ba'i phyir yongs su sbyang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva has made them fit vessels for the bodhisattva's power and engagement in that, but the gods of the form realm are not vessels for the truths and are not to be purified because they do not see the appearance of the Buddha.

original: 'gro ba rmi lam la bkra shis par 'dod pa de bas na 'gro ba bdag nyid la bstan par bya ba'i phyir rgya che ba'i snang ba'i 'od mthu chen po'i snang bas khyab par gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba rmi lam la bkra shis par 'dod pa de bas na 'gro ba bdag nyid la bstan par bya ba'i phyir rgya che ba'i snang ba'i 'od mthu chen po'i snang bas khyab par gyur te /
translated: Since it is held that the world is auspicious in a dream, therefore, in order to demonstrate that to the world, the great light of the powerful appearance pervades.

original: nyi ma'i snang bas lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi ma'i snang bas lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is superior to the light of the sun.

original: 'jig rten ni snod kyi 'jig rten yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni snod kyi 'jig rten yin la /
translated: The world is the physical world.

original: 'jig rten gyi bar ni khor yug gis zlum por byas pa bzhi po dag gi yang phrag la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bar ni khor yug gis zlum por byas pa bzhi po dag gi yang phrag la bya'o //
translated: The space between the worlds is the space between the four continents, which are surrounded by an ocean.

original: mun pas ma mthong ba'i phyir 'jug pa med par 'gyur ba mun pa'i thad las mun nag tu btsud pa yin gyi /ğŸ”½mig @91a * //
analyzed: mun pas ma mthong ba'i phyir 'jug pa med par 'gyur ba mun pa'i thad las mun nag tu btsud pa yin gyi / mig @91a * //
translated: The darkness is not a place where one cannot enter because of darkness, but rather it is a place where one cannot see because of darkness.

original: dang bral ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dang bral ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: The darkness is not a place where one cannot see because of the absence of eyes,

original: mun pas mun nag tu gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mun pas mun nag tu gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: but rather it is a place where one cannot see because of darkness.

original: mun pa gzhan gyis mun pa dang ldan pa ma yin zhing rgyal ba la sogs pas byas pa las mun nag tu 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mun pa gzhan gyis mun pa dang ldan pa ma yin zhing rgyal ba la sogs pas byas pa las mun nag tu 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Darkness is not darkness because it is associated with another darkness, nor is it darkness because it is created by RÄhu, etc.ğŸ”½Darkness is darkness because it is a place where one cannot see because of darkness.

original: gang gi phyir rgyal ba la sogs pas byas pas kyang mun par mthong ba'i 'khrul pa de'i phyir mun pa mun nag ces bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyal ba la sogs pas byas pas kyang mun par mthong ba'i 'khrul pa de'i phyir mun pa mun nag ces bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
translated: Those who think that darkness is darkness because it is created by RÄhu, etc., are mistaken, and therefore darkness is distinguished as darkness.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po ni rang nyid kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa kho nas so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po ni rang nyid kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa kho nas so //
translated: Those of great magical power are so because of their own perfection of good qualities.

original: mthu chen po ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa kho nas so //
analyzed: mthu chen po ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa kho nas so //
translated: Great power is due to the benefit of others.

original: 'ga' zhig bdag nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pa dag ni yod kyi gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bdag nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pa dag ni yod kyi gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Some have their own perfections, but not the benefit of others.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa yod dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa yod dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They have their own perfections and the benefit of others through their own magical power.

original: 'od kyis zhes bya ba ni 'od zer stong gi gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: 'od kyis zhes bya ba ni 'od zer stong gi gzugs kyis so //
translated: By light means by the form of a thousand light rays.

original: snang ba ni gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: snang ba ni gsal ba yin la /
translated: Illumination is clarity.

original: byed ma nus pa ni zil gyis gnon par ma nus pa'o //
analyzed: byed ma nus pa ni zil gyis gnon par ma nus pa'o //
translated: Unable to do means unable to overpower.

original: gang gi phyir 'od snang bar gyur pas kyang de dag snang bar bya ba nyid du nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'od snang bar gyur pas kyang de dag snang bar bya ba nyid du nus pa med pa'o //
translated: Because even though the light is illuminated, they are not able to illuminate.

original: khyab pa ni gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ni gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Permeation is clarity.

original: rang gi dpung ba nas zhes bya ba ni thag nye ba nas so //
analyzed: rang gi dpung ba nas zhes bya ba ni thag nye ba nas so //
translated: From his own arm means from near.

original: lus kyi dbang pos bzung ba dang reg pa na mthong bar yang mi nus na 'on kyang gzhan du lta ci smos //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang pos bzung ba dang reg pa na mthong bar yang mi nus na 'on kyang gzhan du lta ci smos //
translated: When it is grasped and touched by the body faculty, it is not even able to be seen, much less elsewhere.

original: kye sems can gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: kye sems can gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni dga' ba yin te /
translated: The two words â€œand other sentient beingsâ€ are the cause of joy.

original: gang gi phyir de dag dga' bar gyur pa de'i tshe 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag dga' bar gyur pa de'i tshe 'gyur te /
translated: Because they are joyful, they are joyful.

original: sems can gzhan mthong ba'i phyir ram skyo ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can gzhan mthong ba'i phyir ram skyo ba yin te /
translated: They are joyful because they see other sentient beings, or they are joyful because they are compassionate.

original: gzhan dag gis sdug bsngal mthong ba las kyang skyo bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis sdug bsngal mthong ba las kyang skyo bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: They are compassionate because they see the suffering of others.

original: aa ra da'i rgyud yin pas na tshangs sbyin no //
analyzed: aa ra da'i rgyud yin pas na tshangs sbyin no //
translated: Brahmadatta is the son of Brahmadatta.

original: gzugs can snying po zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzugs dper bya ba yod pas na gzugs can yin la /
analyzed: gzugs can snying po zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzugs dper bya ba yod pas na gzugs can yin la /
translated: Bimbisara is the one who has a form that is an example, because he has a form that is an example.

original: snying po ni rgyal srid brtan por btsugs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snying po ni rgyal srid brtan por btsugs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is the essence because he is firmly established in the kingdom.

original: gsal ba las kyang gsal zhing dri ma med pa ni gsal zhing gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba las kyang gsal zhing dri ma med pa ni gsal zhing gsal ba yin te /
translated: He is clear and pure because he is clear and pure.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' skyes par gyur pa'i 'od kyis ljongs mun pa bsal ba bzhin du grags pa dang ldan pas na gsal rgyal te gsal bar byas pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' skyes par gyur pa'i 'od kyis ljongs mun pa bsal ba bzhin du grags pa dang ldan pas na gsal rgyal te gsal bar byas pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Because the light of the Bodhisattva's birth illuminated the countryside as if dispelling darkness, he was called Prasenajit, illuminator, up to illuminated.

original: 'jig pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni @91b 'jig rten 'jig pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni @91b 'jig rten 'jig pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Skilled in destruction means skilled in the destruction of the world.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig pa'i dus su sems can dag bsam pa can gcig tu 'du zhing tshogs pa'i 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig pa'i dus su sems can dag bsam pa can gcig tu 'du zhing tshogs pa'i 'jig pa'o //
translated: Because at the time of destruction, sentient beings gather together in one place and are destroyed.

original: 'jig rten gyi yang srid ldog pa de'i rnam par dpyad pa shes pa ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yang srid ldog pa de'i rnam par dpyad pa shes pa ni mkhas pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the analysis of the cessation of worldly existence is skill.

original: yang yang zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du'o //
analyzed: yang yang zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du'o //
translated: Again and again means repeatedly.

original: chen po ni rgya chen pos so //
analyzed: chen po ni rgya chen pos so //
translated: Great means vast.

original: khyab pa ni gsal bar gyur pas so //
analyzed: khyab pa ni gsal bar gyur pas so //
translated: Pervaded means illuminated.

original: ci nyi ma bdun cig car shar bar gyur tam /
analyzed: ci nyi ma bdun cig car shar bar gyur tam /
translated: Did the seven suns rise at once?

original: de dag gang zhes dogs pa la smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gang zhes dogs pa la smras pa /
translated: Fearing that one might ask this, he said:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir ri dang / phug tu bcas pa 'od zer te 'od kyis gsal bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir ri dang / phug tu bcas pa 'od zer te 'od kyis gsal bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: Thus, because the light of the Sage, which is like a mountain or a cave, is radiant,ğŸ”½the light of the sun, which is hot and burning, is cool.

original: nyi ma ste snang byed kyi 'od ni rno zhing sreg pa yin la bsil ba ni 'od 'di ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma ste snang byed kyi 'od ni rno zhing sreg pa yin la bsil ba ni 'od 'di ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: This light generates delight.

original: nges pa ni de dag thub pa'i 'od yin bas gsal ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni de dag thub pa'i 'od yin bas gsal ba'o //
translated: It is certain that they are radiant because they are the light of the Sage.

original: de dag gang las she na /
analyzed: de dag gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: smras pa / gang gi phyir lus te gzugs 'di la rab tu 'jug pa bzhin du lus thams cad la dga' ba skyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi phyir lus te gzugs 'di la rab tu 'jug pa bzhin du lus thams cad la dga' ba skyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because this form, the body, is like an entrance, it generates delight in the entire body.

original: gdon mi za ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yum gyi lhums nas 'byung ba'i dri ma med pa'i 'od yin pas shin tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yum gyi lhums nas 'byung ba'i dri ma med pa'i 'od yin pas shin tu gsal ba'o //
translated: The light of the Bodhisattva emerging from his mother's womb is certainly stainless, and therefore very radiant.

original: 'od chen po can zhes bya ba ni 'od gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' 'od chen po can no //
analyzed: 'od chen po can zhes bya ba ni 'od gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' 'od chen po can no //
translated: The one with great light is the Bodhisattva who has that light.

original: gser gyi kha dog lta bu zhes bya ba ni gser btso ma'i mdog lta bus so //
analyzed: gser gyi kha dog lta bu zhes bya ba ni gser btso ma'i mdog lta bus so //
translated: Golden-colored means the color of refined gold.

original: 'jig rten gsum du zhas bya ba la 'jig rten pa'i gzhung gis ni lha dang mi dang klu'i 'jig rten ngag yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du zhas bya ba la 'jig rten pa'i gzhung gis ni lha dang mi dang klu'i 'jig rten ngag yin la /
translated: The three worlds means the three worlds of gods, humans, and nagas according to worldly scriptures.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyis ni mi dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha dag gi gnas skabs ni 'jig rten gsum yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyis ni mi dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha dag gi gnas skabs ni 'jig rten gsum yin no //
translated: According to the system of tenets, the three worlds are the states of humans, gods who enjoy the desire realm, and gods who enjoy the form realm.

original: mthu che ba mthu che ba zhes bya ba ni gtso bo gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mthu che ba mthu che ba zhes bya ba ni gtso bo gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: Great power means they are the most important.

original: blta bar dka' ba ni blta ba nyid du nus pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: blta bar dka' ba ni blta ba nyid du nus pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Difficult to see means they are not able to be seen.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi dbang gis ser skya'i gnas su bsnyen bkur ba la sogs pa skyes pa de dag ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po gang yin pa de dag thams cad rang gi las kho na las grub pa yin gyi gzhan
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi dbang gis ser skya'i gnas su bsnyen bkur ba la sogs pa skyes pa de dag ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po gang yin pa de dag thams cad rang gi las kho na las grub pa yin gyi gzhan
translated: Those born in Kapilavastu through the power of the Bodhisattvas merit and so on are all established from their own karma, not from the power of others.

original: gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the maturation of karma done by one person cannot be experienced by another.

original: dga' ba skyes pa zhes bya ba ni @92a * //
analyzed: dga' ba skyes pa zhes bya ba ni @92a * //
translated: The phrase having given rise to joy means

original: rnyed pa 'phel bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'phel bar gyur pa'o //
translated: that they have increased their wealth.

original: don thams cad ces bya ba la 'byor pa thams cad ma bsags par grub pa ste 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: don thams cad ces bya ba la 'byor pa thams cad ma bsags par grub pa ste 'byor pa'o //
translated: The phrase all their goals means that all their goals are accomplished without being sought.

original: las kyi mtha' thams cad ces bya ba 'dis ni phun sum tshogs pa rtsom pa dang grub pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' thams cad ces bya ba 'dis ni phun sum tshogs pa rtsom pa dang grub pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase all their activities shows the cause for the accomplishment of their undertakings.

original: khyogs ni 'degs pa'i khri'o //
analyzed: khyogs ni 'degs pa'i khri'o //
translated: A palanquin is a litter.

original: nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pas bdag nyid dang 'dra ba gzhan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pas bdag nyid dang 'dra ba gzhan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase those who are proud means those who do not see anyone else who is equal to themselves in terms of social class and so on.

original: kha drag pa zhes bya ba ni zhum pa med par smra ba'o //
analyzed: kha drag pa zhes bya ba ni zhum pa med par smra ba'o //
translated: The phrase those who are bold means those who speak without timidity.

original: mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi 'jug pa thams cad la gus pa med par spobs pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi 'jug pa thams cad la gus pa med par spobs pa skye ba'o //
translated: The phrase those who are fearless means those who speak with confidence in all situations without any sense of inferiority.

original: thub pa zhes bya ba ni ngag gi 'jug pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: thub pa zhes bya ba ni ngag gi 'jug pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: The word sage means the pacification of verbal activity.

original: gnyug mar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu gnas pa'o //
translated: The word abiding means abiding constantly.

original: de'i drung du zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i skyed byed kyi lha stegs la mngon du phyogs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: de'i drung du zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i skyed byed kyi lha stegs la mngon du phyogs pa dag gis so //
translated: In his presence means in the presence of the gods who are the progenitors of the Shakyas.

original: myur ba'i 'gros su song nas zhes bya ba ni mgyogs par song nas so //
analyzed: myur ba'i 'gros su song nas zhes bya ba ni mgyogs par song nas so //
translated: Having gone with a swift gait means having gone quickly.

original: lha rnams kyis kyang mchod pa nyid kyi phyir lha'i lha'o //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang mchod pa nyid kyi phyir lha'i lha'o //
translated: He is a god of gods because he is worshipped even by the gods.

original: rgyu mtshan gyis tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir mtshan mkhan no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyis tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir mtshan mkhan no //
translated: He is a reader of signs because he makes conventional designations by means of signs.

original: skar mkhan ni skar ma'i bstan bcos kyi rnam par dbye ba la mkhas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skar mkhan ni skar ma'i bstan bcos kyi rnam par dbye ba la mkhas par gyur pa'o //
translated: He is an astrologer because he is skilled in the divisions of the science of the stars.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ni zhabs legs par gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ni zhabs legs par gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The thirty-two marks of a great person are the well-placed feet and so on.

original: rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis kyi gnas skabs su 'gyur ba'o //

original: khyim pa ni khyim na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa ni khyim na gnas pa'o //

analyzed: rgyal ba ni rgyal ba'i ngang tshul can no //

analyzed: chos spyod par byed pa'i phyir chos dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: chos kyi yul sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: rin po che ni rnyed dka' ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par byed pa'o //ğŸ”½khyim bdag rin po che ni bang mdzod kyi bdag po byed pa'o //

original: ser po bgos nas so //
analyzed: ser po bgos nas so //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid gsungs pa'o //

translated: He is renowned means that he is well known everywhere.ğŸ”½By the power of the bodhisattva, the magic of the á¹›á¹£is was suppressed.

analyzed: pa ma yin nam /

translated: The gods blessed him so that he would enter the Buddhaâ€™s teaching.

analyzed: byang chub kyi lam gyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //

original: blo ste shes pa 'khrul pa ni yongs su shes pa nyid dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir gang gis 'di la 'khor los sgyur ba nyid du de dag gis lung bstan pa 'khrul pa yin no //

original: de gang las she na /

analyzed: rtsod dus na ni 'khor los sgyur ba zhes smos so //

original: tshe lo brgya pa'i dus ni @93b rtsod pa'i dus yin na /
analyzed: tshe lo brgya pa'i dus ni @93b rtsod pa'i dus yin na /
translated: The age of one hundred years is the age of discord.ğŸ”½How can there be universal monarchs at that time?

analyzed: sems dogs par 'gyur ba ni 'di'i sems dogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba'am /

original: skyo ba thob par 'gyur ba'o ;

analyzed: mi dbang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /

original: bdag gi rgud pa ste nyams pa mthong bas gang gi phyir zhi ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gi rgud pa ste nyams pa mthong bas gang gi phyir zhi ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because of seeing my own misfortune, my own destruction, I have not attained peace, that is, nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di'i gan du phyin nas don ma grub par shi bar 'gyur ro zhes du ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di'i gan du phyin nas don ma grub par shi bar 'gyur ro zhes du ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, having come to this Bodhisattva, I will die without accomplishing my purpose.

original: skal ldan zhes bya ba ni bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: skal ldan zhes bya ba ni bsten par bya'o //
translated: He says, â€œFortunate one,â€ that is, he should be relied upon.

original: bsod nams ldan zhes bya ba ni sdig pa dang bral zhing dag byed du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ldan zhes bya ba ni sdig pa dang bral zhing dag byed du gyur pa'o //
translated: He says, â€œMeritorious one,â€ that is, free from sin and become pure.

original: mtshungs pa med pa'i bzhin te gdong gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i bzhin te gdong gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He says, â€œWith an incomparable face,â€ that is, on whose face it exists.

original: dus su zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: dus su zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: â€œIn timeâ€ means in the state of perfect Buddhahood.

original: sgra mchog ces bya ba ni smra ba po ma lus pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sgra mchog ces bya ba ni smra ba po ma lus pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: â€œSupreme soundâ€ means that he is the chief of all speakers.

original: mchog tu zhi bar zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su'o //
analyzed: mchog tu zhi bar zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su'o //
translated: â€œSupreme peaceâ€ means in the realm of nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: log pa'i lta bas bcom pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi lta bas gnon par gyur pa'i rgyu can dag go //
analyzed: log pa'i lta bas bcom pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi lta bas gnon par gyur pa'i rgyu can dag go //
translated: â€œCrushed by false viewsâ€ means that they are overcome by distorted views.

original: g-yo sgyu'i kun tu spyod pa la 'jug na zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi gya gyu'i 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo sgyu'i kun tu spyod pa la 'jug na zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi gya gyu'i 'gyur ba'o //
translated: â€œEngaged in deceitful conductâ€ means that they are deceitful in body and speech.

original: 'dod kyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod kyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: â€œDesireâ€ means strong desire.

original: mi 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
analyzed: mi 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
translated: â€œFor the sake of immortalityâ€ means mentally.

original: 'chi ba med pa rtsol ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa rtsol ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
translated: â€œStriving for immortalityâ€ means in body and speech.

original: bram ze'i rigs kyis bdag ni bram ze yin zhing bram ze dag pa yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir bdag rigs gzhan gyi tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya zhes bya ba ni rus smras pa yin la /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs kyis bdag ni bram ze yin zhing bram ze dag pa yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir bdag rigs gzhan gyi tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya zhes bya ba ni rus smras pa yin la /
translated: The brahmin caste says, â€œI am a brahmin and brahmins are pure, so why should I practice the pure conduct of other castes?â€ This is caste boasting.

original: bdag ni bar dva dza la sogs pa'i rgyud yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyud smra ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni bar dva dza la sogs pa'i rgyud yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyud smra ba yin no //
translated: The VÄtsÄ«putrÄ«ya and so on say, â€œI am a lineage of the middle class and so on.â€ This is lineage boasting.

original: yid kyi 'don pa dang ldan pa spyod pa dang ldan pa rig byed kyi don la mkhas pa gang yin pa de smra bar mi bya zhing lhag par spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'don pa dang ldan pa spyod pa dang ldan pa rig byed kyi don la mkhas pa gang yin pa de smra bar mi bya zhing lhag par spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not boast about being a scholar who is learned in the meaning of the Vedas and who possesses mental recitation and conduct.

original: gong nas gong du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la drang srong 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i thabs rnyed nas byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod la cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lung mnos te /ğŸ”½cung zad med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du'o //ğŸ”½de yan chad lung 'bogs pa med pa'i phyir srid pa'i rtse @94b mo'i 'dod chags dang bral bar ma nus pa de bas na 'ga' zhig tu gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i don gyi 'di lam du 'gyur ro zhes lo drug gi bar du dka' ba
analyzed: gong nas gong du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la drang srong 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i thabs rnyed nas byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod la cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lung mnos te / cung zad med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du'o // de yan chad lung 'bogs pa med pa'i phyir srid pa'i rtse @94b mo'i 'dod chags dang bral bar ma nus pa de bas na 'ga' zhig tu gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i don gyi 'di lam du 'gyur ro zhes lo drug gi bar du dka' ba
translated: Similarly, he was free from attachment to the form realm and so on up to being free from attachment to the base of nothingness.ğŸ”½Since there was no one to give him instruction beyond that, he was unable to become free from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: spyad pa brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: spyad pa brtsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he began to practice austerities for six years, thinking, I will become free from attachment to the formless realm and this will be the path.

original: cung zad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œNot even a littleâ€ and so on means that he did not accomplish the desired result.

original: ji ltar bde bar dbugs phyung ste zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'gog par byed pa'i nang gi bum pa'i bsam gtan las ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar dbugs phyung ste zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'gog par byed pa'i nang gi bum pa'i bsam gtan las ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: â€œHaving breathed easilyâ€ means that he turned away from the meditative absorption of the inner space, which stops the in-breath and out-breath.

original: zhal zas rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni til dang 'bras gcig tsam bzhes pa las so sor ldog par gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: zhal zas rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni til dang 'bras gcig tsam bzhes pa las so sor ldog par gyur pa'o ;
translated: â€œHaving eaten a lotâ€ means that he turned away from the austerity of eating only one sesame seed and one grain of rice.

original: / zhun mar dang 'bru mar gyis zhes bya ba ni dri ma dang 'dam 'chang bar mdzad pa'i dka' thub las ldog par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: / zhun mar dang 'bru mar gyis zhes bya ba ni dri ma dang 'dam 'chang bar mdzad pa'i dka' thub las ldog par gyur pa'o //
translated: â€œHaving used ghee and oilâ€ means that he turned away from the austerity of smearing himself with dirt and mud.

original: chab dron pos zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid med par gyur pa las ldog par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: chab dron pos zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid med par gyur pa las ldog par gyur pa yin la /
translated: â€œHaving used warm waterâ€ means that he turned away from the austerity of not bathing.

original: chu dron po ni cung zad dro ba'o //
analyzed: chu dron po ni cung zad dro ba'o //
translated: â€œWarm waterâ€ is water that is slightly warm.

original: lan bcu drug tu bzlas pa zhes bya ba ni lan bcu drug tu bzlas shing goms par byas pa la bzlas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lan bcu drug tu bzlas pa zhes bya ba ni lan bcu drug tu bzlas shing goms par byas pa la bzlas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The term recitation means recitation and familiarization sixteen times.

original: stong la sogs pa brgyad pa'i mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: stong la sogs pa brgyad pa'i mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: It is completed with the eight, such as a thousand.

original: sde tshan brgyad kyi tshoms re re la blud pa dang bzhos pa byas par gyur pa ni lan bcu drug bzlas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sde tshan brgyad kyi tshoms re re la blud pa dang bzhos pa byas par gyur pa ni lan bcu drug bzlas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Each group of eight is a milking and a recitation, making sixteen recitations.

original: rtsva bkra shis 'tshong zhing rtsvas spyod pa gang yin ba de'i thad las rtsva dag bzhes nas so //ğŸ”½ma 'khrugs pa ni rtsva ba dang rtse mo gcig tu lhags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsva bkra shis 'tshong zhing rtsvas spyod pa gang yin ba de'i thad las rtsva dag bzhes nas so // ma 'khrugs pa ni rtsva ba dang rtse mo gcig tu lhags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He took the grass from the one who was selling auspicious grass and using the grass.ğŸ”½It was undisturbed because the grass and tips were gathered together.

original: mthug srab tu ma gyur pa ni khyab par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mthug srab tu ma gyur pa ni khyab par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It was not thick or thin because it was evenly spread.

original: gdan bshams pa ni rtsva'i mal bting nas so //
analyzed: gdan bshams pa ni rtsva'i mal bting nas so //
translated: The seat was prepared by spreading the grass mat.

original: skyil mo krung bcas pa ni skyil krung bcings pa'o//
analyzed: skyil mo krung bcas pa ni skyil krung bcings pa'o//
translated: He sat cross-legged, meaning he bound his legs in the cross-legged position.

original: sku drang por bsrangs nas zhes bya ba ni mdzad nas so //
analyzed: sku drang por bsrangs nas zhes bya ba ni mdzad nas so //
translated: Having straightened his body, meaning having done so.

original: sku bsrang ba ni rked pa'i phyogs nas brtsams nas lto ba'i bar rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sku bsrang ba ni rked pa'i phyogs nas brtsams nas lto ba'i bar rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: Straightening the body means that, beginning from the waist, one expands the belly.

original: dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag ste /
analyzed: dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag ste /
translated: He places mindfulness in front of him.

original: so sor mngon du phyogs pa ni dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor mngon du phyogs pa ni dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag pa yin te /
translated: Mindfulness is in front of him who has it.

original: rnal 'byor pas sna'i rtse mo la blta ba'i 'jug pa ni bsam gtan byed ba'o zhes 'jig rten pa smra ba yod pas sna'i rtse mo la mig gtod na dran pa yang bsgom par bya ba don de nyid la gzhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas sna'i rtse mo la blta ba'i 'jug pa ni bsam gtan byed ba'o zhes 'jig rten pa smra ba yod pas sna'i rtse mo la mig gtod na dran pa yang bsgom par bya ba don de nyid la gzhag par 'gyur te /
translated: Since there are worldly people who say that the yogiÌ„ should practice concentration by looking at the tip of the nose, if he directs his eyes to the tip of the nose, he will be meditating on mindfulness and will be placed in the object itself.

original: de bas na 'dir lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la yang brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i rgyu mtshan ting nge 'dzin @95a * //ğŸ”½gyi yan lag yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la yang brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i rgyu mtshan ting nge 'dzin @95a * // gyi yan lag yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, here, the cause of the exertion in the various conditions of the body is the limb of samadhi.

original: thugs bskyed pa zhes bya bas ni thugs brtan por mdzad pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thugs bskyed pa zhes bya bas ni thugs brtan por mdzad pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By â€œarousing the mindâ€ he shows the firmness of the mind.

original: gsung brjod pa zhes bya ba ni lha dpang por bzhag pa'i phyir gsung brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gsung brjod pa zhes bya ba ni lha dpang por bzhag pa'i phyir gsung brjod pa'o //
translated: The utterance is the utterance of the words for the purpose of establishing the gods as witnesses.

original: gzhan gyi don mdzad pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni gtso bor gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don mdzad pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni gtso bor gyur pa yin la /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are the foremost in accomplishing the aims of others.

original: gzhan gyi yang chos bstan pa med par mdzad mi spyod pa de bas na ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang chos bstan pa'i phyir tshangs bas bskul ba la gzhes par mdzad /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang chos bstan pa med par mdzad mi spyod pa de bas na ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang chos bstan pa'i phyir tshangs bas bskul ba la gzhes par mdzad /
translated: They do not act without teaching the Dharma to others. Therefore, how is it that the Blessed One, having attained complete enlightenment, abided in the request of Brahma to teach the Dharma?

original: 'on kyang thog ma nyid du chos ston par mi mdzad ce na /
analyzed: 'on kyang thog ma nyid du chos ston par mi mdzad ce na /
translated: Why did he not teach the Dharma from the very beginning?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: tshangs pas bskul ba la gzhes pa yang sems can gyi don kho na yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pas bskul ba la gzhes pa yang sems can gyi don kho na yin te /
translated: Abiding in the request of Brahma is also for the sake of sentient beings alone.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs na spyod pa'i lha gcig pa ma yin pa dag 'di ltar tshangs pa la tshangs pa dang / tshangs pa chen po dang / byed pa po dang / sbrul pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa chen po nyid kyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs na spyod pa'i lha gcig pa ma yin pa dag 'di ltar tshangs pa la tshangs pa dang / tshangs pa chen po dang / byed pa po dang / sbrul pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa chen po nyid kyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Because the gods who experience form do not have a single thought of Brahma, such as Brahma, Great Brahma, the creator, the transformer, etc.,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang mi gcig pa ma yin pa dag kyang tshangs pa la ston pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang mi gcig pa ma yin pa dag kyang tshangs pa la ston pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the gods and humans who experience desire do not have a single thought of Brahma as a teacher.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar tshangs pa chen po 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te chos ston par bskul bar gyur pa de'i tshe tshangs pa chen po nyid kyi blo skye bar gyur pa dang / ston pa'i blo skye ba gang yin pa de dag blo de dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar tshangs pa chen po 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te chos ston par bskul bar gyur pa de'i tshe tshangs pa chen po nyid kyi blo skye bar gyur pa dang / ston pa'i blo skye ba gang yin pa de dag blo de dang bral ba dang /
translated: When Great Brahma came into the presence of the Bhagavan, bowed to the Bhagavan, and requested him to teach the Dharma, at that time Great Brahma had a thought of himself as Great Brahma and a thought of the Bhagavan as a teacher.

original: de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la chen po nyid kyi blo dang / ston pa'i blo skye ste /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la chen po nyid kyi blo dang / ston pa'i blo skye ste /
translated: When they were free from those thoughts, they had a thought of the Bhagavan as Great Brahma and a thought of the Bhagavan as a teacher.

original: yon tan gang gis 'di shin tu chen po yin te /
analyzed: yon tan gang gis 'di shin tu chen po yin te /
translated: What is the quality by which this is so great?

original: de la tshangs pa chen po yang phyag 'tshal bar byed pa dang / chos bstan pa'i phyir bskul lo zhes bcom ldan 'das la gus pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la tshangs pa chen po yang phyag 'tshal bar byed pa dang / chos bstan pa'i phyir bskul lo zhes bcom ldan 'das la gus pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: He generates respect for the Lord, thinking: â€œEven the Great Brahma bows down to him and implores him to teach the Dharma.â€

original: bcom ldan 'das las chos thos nas shin tu che ba'i bye brag khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las chos thos nas shin tu che ba'i bye brag khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: And having heard the Dharma from the Lord, he understands the distinction of his greatness.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das tshangs pas bskul ba la gzhes par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das tshangs pas bskul ba la gzhes par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Lord acquiesces to the request of Brahma to teach the Dharma.

original: rtag tu dus ston chen pos zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyu dus tshigs kyi dga' ston chen po'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dus ston chen pos zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyu dus tshigs kyi dga' ston chen po'o //
translated: â€œAlways with a great festivalâ€ means with a great festival of the season, which is the cause of happiness.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni rab tu mgu ba'o //ğŸ”½dbang po lnga zhes bya ba ni gtso bo lnga yin la /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni rab tu mgu ba'o // dbang po lnga zhes bya ba ni gtso bo lnga yin la /
translated: â€œDelightedâ€ means very pleased.ğŸ”½The â€œfive sensesâ€ are the five principal ones.

original: nye ba'i dbang po lnga zhes bya ba ni nyes ba'i gtso bo lnga yin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i dbang po lnga zhes bya ba ni nyes ba'i gtso bo lnga yin te /
translated: The â€œfive secondary sensesâ€ are the five secondary ones.

original: grong khyer rgya che ba @95b nyid ni gtso bo nyung du dag gi gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grong khyer rgya che ba @95b nyid ni gtso bo nyung du dag gi gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The city is not held by a few principal ones, because it is so vast.

original: ngos bzhi bzhi so phag gis brtsigs pa dang / bang rim can du bsgrubs pa'i rdzing bu ni rdzing bu yin la /
analyzed: ngos bzhi bzhi so phag gis brtsigs pa dang / bang rim can du bsgrubs pa'i rdzing bu ni rdzing bu yin la /
translated: The four sides are built of bricks, and there are ponds with steps leading down into them.

original: rdzing bu de dag las kyang chu 'dzin pa'i yur ba rab tu g-yogs ba grong khyer du 'jug pa de'i phyir yur ba lnga brgya po de dag dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag las kyang chu 'dzin pa'i yur ba rab tu g-yogs ba grong khyer du 'jug pa de'i phyir yur ba lnga brgya po de dag dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And from those ponds, canals that hold water are spread out, entering the city. Therefore, it is endowed with those five hundred canals.

original: yan lag gi mchog lnga ni zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i yan lag gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi mchog lnga ni zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i yan lag gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: The five supreme limbs are the most important limbs of the king.

original: 'byor pa ni rdzas las byas pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa ni rdzas las byas pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Wealth is the excellence of what is made of material things.

original: khams ma snyoms pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa ma snyoms pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: khams ma snyoms pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa ma snyoms pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because of an imbalance of elements means that it is a condition of an imbalance of the earth element, etc.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: Or it is of wind, etc.

original: gnyid med pa'i nad kyis zhes bya ba ni gnyid med par gyur pa'i nad kho nas so //
analyzed: gnyid med pa'i nad kyis zhes bya ba ni gnyid med par gyur pa'i nad kho nas so //
translated: The disease of insomnia means the disease of just becoming sleepless.

original: rdzas sna tshogs bsags pa'i bye brag ces bya ba ni gnyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i rdzas rnam pa du ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i mar blud par byas na'o ;
analyzed: rdzas sna tshogs bsags pa'i bye brag ces bya ba ni gnyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i rdzas rnam pa du ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i mar blud par byas na'o ;
translated: The phrase a variety of substances refers to the fact that the patient is given a drink that contains many different substances that are suitable for inducing sleep.

original: / mgo ba'i rtsa nas blon par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi thams cad du mgrin pa'i phyogs nas gcod cing 'dor bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / mgo ba'i rtsa nas blon par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi thams cad du mgrin pa'i phyogs nas gcod cing 'dor bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase from the artery of the head means that the poison is removed from the throat.

original: dgra bos 'ongs par dogs pa nyam da ba'i gnas la skyes bu nges par sbyar ba ni gcan pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bos 'ongs par dogs pa nyam da ba'i gnas la skyes bu nges par sbyar ba ni gcan pa'o //
translated: The phrase a person who is employed by an enemy who fears an attack means that the person is employed by an enemy who fears an attack.

original: bzod pa ni brnags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa ni brnags par gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase a person who is patient means that the person is forbearing.

original: thugs gzung ba zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du bye dpa'i sgo nas sems yongs su mgu bar bya bar ro //
analyzed: thugs gzung ba zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du bye dpa'i sgo nas sems yongs su mgu bar bya bar ro //
translated: The phrase to win over means to please the mind by means of a verbal expression.

original: dgra bo ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bo ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: The phrase an enemy who is a rival means a person who is hostile.

original: dogs shing skyo nas zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod pa'i dogs pa gang yin pa des sems skyo bar gyur nas so //

original: bsam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa ni sngar byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa ni sngar byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: The explanation of the thought, etc., is the same as before.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The four noble truths are thoroughly realized.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: It is in accord with the comprehension of the four noble truths.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu'i bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu'i bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the twenty peaks of the mountain of the view of individuality is to be understood as before.

original: legs bshad rnam shes snying po ste //
analyzed: legs bshad rnam shes snying po ste //
translated: The good explanation is the essence of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In regard to the statement,

original: shes shing khong du chud pa'i snying po ste /
analyzed: shes shing khong du chud pa'i snying po ste /
translated: it is the essence of consciousness,ğŸ”½it is the essence of the understanding of consciousness.ğŸ”½It is the essence of the understanding of the reality of consciousness.ğŸ”½It is the good explanation in regard to which there is that.

original: don legs par bshad pa gang la yod pa de dag ni rnam shes snying po'am rnam shes de kho na nyid khong du chud pa'i snying po de legs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste gang gi phyir gang las de kho na'i blo
analyzed: don legs par bshad pa gang la yod pa de dag ni rnam shes snying po'am rnam shes de kho na nyid khong du chud pa'i snying po de legs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste gang gi phyir gang las de kho na'i blo
translated: It is so called because of the understanding of thatness, i.e., of the reality of consciousness, from which there is that.

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i legs par bshad pa de ni snying po dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i legs par bshad pa de ni snying po dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That good explanation which does not generate those two is not meaningful.

original: thos pa'i yang rnam par shes pa'i ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin snying po yin pas snying po ste /
analyzed: thos pa'i yang rnam par shes pa'i ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin snying po yin pas snying po ste /
translated: The essence of hearing is the wisdom of consciousness and concentration, and since it is the essence, it is meaningful.

original: 'bras bu de gnyis thob pa gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu de gnyis thob pa gang la yod pa ste /
translated: That which possesses those two results is meaningful.

original: gang gis lung phog pa med par legs par bshad pa'i don khong du chud par gyur pha ni rang gi cha ba'i dbang du byas nas tshig snga ma bzhin gyis lung phog pa'i stobs kyis thos pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gis lung phog pa med par legs par bshad pa'i don khong du chud par gyur pha ni rang gi cha ba'i dbang du byas nas tshig snga ma bzhin gyis lung phog pa'i stobs kyis thos pa yin la /
translated: One who comprehends the meaning of good explanation without being taught is hearing from the perspective of one's own part, by the power of being taught the previous words.

original: gal te legs par bshad pa de thos pa'i stobs kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang ting nge 'dzin skye par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gal te legs par bshad pa de thos pa'i stobs kyis thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang ting nge 'dzin skye par 'gyur ba /
translated: If the wisdom arisen from hearing and concentration arise through the power of hearing that good explanation,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i thos pa skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i thos pa skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: at that time, hearing with its result has arisen.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: de nyid de dag don chen shes thos med ces smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de dag don chen shes thos med ces smos pa yin no //
translated: That itself is stated as: They know the great meaning of those without hearing.

original: brtags pa ni thos pa med par spyad pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni thos pa med par spyad pa'o //
translated: Investigation is the practice without learning.

original: bag med pa ni dge ba la mngon par sbyor ba la rab tu lhod pa yin te /
analyzed: bag med pa ni dge ba la mngon par sbyor ba la rab tu lhod pa yin te /
translated: Negligence is the extreme laxity in the application to virtue.

original: de dag go rims bzhin du bdag dang gzhan la legs par bshad pas yongs su shes pa'i phan yon chen por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du bdag dang gzhan la legs par bshad pas yongs su shes pa'i phan yon chen por mi 'gyur te /
translated: These, in order, are not the great benefit of the understanding through the good explanation for oneself and others,

original: de bsgrubs pas 'bras bu sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsgrubs pas 'bras bu sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result is not accomplished by their practice.

original: sangs rgyas gsung ni smra yod kyi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsung ni smra yod kyi //
translated: The Buddha's speech is spoken,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas kyi bka' klog mod kyi khyod la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mi snang ba de'i phyir nge de kho bo'i blo rmongs @98a * //ğŸ”½shing kun nas rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas kyi bka' klog mod kyi khyod la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mi snang ba de'i phyir nge de kho bo'i blo rmongs @98a * // shing kun nas rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: etc. The Buddha's word is read, but the marks of the great man do not appear to you. Therefore, that confuses my mind and makes it completely confused.

original: de bas na bdag gi the tshom myur du bcad cing bsal bar gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi the tshom myur du bcad cing bsal bar gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, quickly cut and remove my doubt.

original: 'dir rtsva gcad pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba ae la'i 'dab ma shing gi lo ma ma bcad pa'i bslab pa'i dus las 'das pa ston par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'byung ba'i 'dri bar byed pa skyed par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rtsva gcad pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba ae la'i 'dab ma shing gi lo ma ma bcad pa'i bslab pa'i dus las 'das pa ston par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'byung ba'i 'dri bar byed pa skyed par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the cutting of the grass should be understood as the occasion when the training rule was passed that the leaves of the tree should not be cut, and this was taught by the Perfectly Awakened One KÄÅ›yapa, and it was the occasion when the questioner who caused the Blessed One to appear was generated.

original: drug pa bdag po rgyal po ste //
analyzed: drug pa bdag po rgyal po ste //
translated: The sixth is the lord, the king.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here,

original: drug pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: drug pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: the sixth is the mental consciousness,

original: drug yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de la drug pa ni drug pa kho na ste /
analyzed: drug yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de la drug pa ni drug pa kho na ste /

original: drug pa kho na dbang byed pa yin te /
analyzed: drug pa kho na dbang byed pa yin te /

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses the three types of conceptualization.

original: bdag po zhes bya ba ni stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag po zhes bya ba ni stobs dang ldan pa yin te /

original: khams gsum pa khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: rgyal po ni dbang sgyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po ni dbang sgyur ba yin te /
translated: The king is the ruler,ğŸ”½because it is the cause of the arising of the three realms.

analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa cig shos dag 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the projecting cause of the other consciousnesses.

original: chags par gyur te 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'di mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa na ste /
analyzed: chags par gyur te 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'di mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa na ste /
translated: When it is attached, i.e., when it is associated with attachment, etc.

original: chags pa dang bcas par gyur na //
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas par gyur na //
translated: When it is attached,

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //ğŸ”½chags pa na ste nyon mongs pa gang la yod pa de ni dri ma can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o // chags pa na ste nyon mongs pa gang la yod pa de ni dri ma can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the remainder of the verse is:ğŸ”½it is defiled.

original: ma chags gyur na ste /
analyzed: ma chags gyur na ste /
translated: When it is not attached,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ming can gyi rdul drug pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ming can gyi rdul drug pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: it is not associated with the six types of particles called attachment, etc.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i bdag gi dngos po de ni ma chags gyur la zhes bya ba yin te ;
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i bdag gi dngos po de ni ma chags gyur la zhes bya ba yin te ;
translated: That is the state of the self which is not attached.

original: /'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: /'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is free from attachment, i.e., free from attachment, etc.

original: rgyud chags pa dang bcas par gyur pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rgyud chags pa dang bcas par gyur pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with the continuum being attached?

original: 'dir ni chags pa byis pa dag tu brjod ces bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pas rgyud dri ma can du byas pa'i drug pa byis pa'i sems can yin pa nas byis pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni chags pa byis pa dag tu brjod ces bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pas rgyud dri ma can du byas pa'i drug pa byis pa'i sems can yin pa nas byis pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: Here, â€œattachment is called childishâ€ means that the sixth, childish beings, whose mindstreams are polluted by attachment and so on, are called childish.ğŸ”½

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the childish are called â€œattachedâ€ because they are sentient beings who have made their mind-streams impure with attachment and so on. They are called â€œchildishâ€ because they are under the power of the afflictions.ğŸ”½The wise are called â€œfree from attachmentâ€ because they have realized the truth of cessation.

original: chags bral mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis khong du chud pa'i phyir ma bstan pa de bas na sems 'dul ba kho na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chags bral mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis khong du chud pa'i phyir ma bstan pa de bas na sems 'dul ba kho na zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that â€œonly the mind is to be disciplined.â€

original: de ltar gyur na phyogs med par rnyed pa thob par @98b 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na phyogs med par rnyed pa thob par @98b 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that one who is like this will obtain gain without bias.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten 'di'i don khong du ma chud pa'i phyir blo dman pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten 'di'i don khong du ma chud pa'i phyir blo dman pa ste /
translated: Those who are of little intelligence, who have not understood the meaning of this world,

original: blo gros ngan pa mya ngan byed la don khong du chud pa'i phyir mkhas pa dag ni dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo gros ngan pa mya ngan byed la don khong du chud pa'i phyir mkhas pa dag ni dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the unwise grieve. But the wise, because they have understood the meaning, are joyful.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni drug pa yid gyi rnam par shes pa la 'dod chags la sogs pas 'byor cing 'brel pa gang yin pa de dang byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir grub pa dang bde bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni drug pa yid gyi rnam par shes pa la 'dod chags la sogs pas 'byor cing 'brel pa gang yin pa de dang byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir grub pa dang bde bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the sixth mental consciousness is associated with attachment and so on, and it is established and happy because it is engaged in that.

original: yon tan ma rnyed pa ni grub pa yin la /
analyzed: yon tan ma rnyed pa ni grub pa yin la /
translated: The acquisition of good qualities is establishment.

original: rnyed nas yongs su skyong bar byed pa ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed nas yongs su skyong bar byed pa ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The protection of what has been acquired is happiness.

original: gsum rig pa zhes bya ba ni rig byed gsum klog pa yin la /
analyzed: gsum rig pa zhes bya ba ni rig byed gsum klog pa yin la /
translated: One who knows the three is one who reads the three Vedas.

original: rig byed gsum ni /
analyzed: rig byed gsum ni /
translated: The three Vedas are:

original: nges brjod dang / snyan dang gas dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed do //ğŸ”½rab tu rig byed pa ni gsal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: nges brjod dang / snyan dang gas dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed do // rab tu rig byed pa ni gsal bar byed pa'am /
translated: the á¹šg Veda, the Yajur Veda, and the SÄma Veda.

original: nyams su myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: One who knows the three Vedas is one who makes them clear or experiences them.

original: rin po che sna bdun sngon du song ba can gyi zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo rin po che la sogs pa rin po che sna bdun gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun sngon du song ba can gyi zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo rin po che la sogs pa rin po che sna bdun gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who has previously obtained the seven jewels is one who has the seven jewels such as the precious wheel.

original: rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i bu stong gis zla ba tshes pa'i rnam pa dang 'dra bar bskor ba ste /
analyzed: rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i bu stong gis zla ba tshes pa'i rnam pa dang 'dra bar bskor ba ste /
translated: He was surrounded by a thousand sons, who were adorned with various precious ornaments, like the form of a crescent moon.

original: bu lnga brgyas ni g-yas phyogs su bu lnga brgyas ni g-yon phyogs nas kun nas bskor bar gyur nas so //
analyzed: bu lnga brgyas ni g-yas phyogs su bu lnga brgyas ni g-yon phyogs nas kun nas bskor bar gyur nas so //
translated: Five hundred sons surrounded him on the right, and five hundred sons surrounded him on the left.

original: 'dir gter dang ldan la yongs su spyod par byed pa dang bral ba na bkren pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gter dang ldan la yongs su spyod par byed pa dang bral ba na bkren pa'o //
translated: Here, a poor person is one who is destitute, lacking in wealth.

original: dman pa ni dbul ba yin la 'dir mi'i mchog ni mkhar gyi rgyal po yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: dman pa ni dbul ba yin la 'dir mi'i mchog ni mkhar gyi rgyal po yin par dgongs so //
translated: The inferior one is the poor one. Here, the king of the city is considered the best of men.

original: rin po che'i rtsibs brgya gdugs gang la yod pa de ni rtsibs brgya pa ste /
analyzed: rin po che'i rtsibs brgya gdugs gang la yod pa de ni rtsibs brgya pa ste /
translated: The one who has a hundred spokes is the one who has a hundred spokes.

original: skyed gu chen po la 'os pa'i gdugs dkar po'o //
analyzed: skyed gu chen po la 'os pa'i gdugs dkar po'o //
translated: It is a white parasol suitable for a great prince.

original: 'od zer stong gi snang bas zhes bya ba ni des snga bar byas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer stong gi snang bas zhes bya ba ni des snga bar byas par gyur pa'o //
translated: The light of a thousand rays means that it was made by him.

original: zla ba dang skar ma dang / gza'i gzhal yang khang bzang po zil gyis gnon pa'i ngag tshul gyi bdag nyid gang la yod pa de ni zla ba dang skar ma dang gza'i gzhal yas khang bzang po rnams zil gyis gnon pa can te /
analyzed: zla ba dang skar ma dang / gza'i gzhal yang khang bzang po zil gyis gnon pa'i ngag tshul gyi bdag nyid gang la yod pa de ni zla ba dang skar ma dang gza'i gzhal yas khang bzang po rnams zil gyis gnon pa can te /
translated: He has the nature of speech that surpasses the excellent celestial mansions of the moon, stars, and planets.

original: de'i mdzes pa zil gyis gnon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mdzes pa zil gyis gnon par byed pa'o //
translated: He surpasses their beauty.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer te 'od zil gyis gnon pa ste gsol bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer te 'od zil gyis gnon pa ste gsol bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The sun's rays are light that surpasses, that is, outshines, the light of the stars.

original: rnam pa rtog pa sna tshogs skyes te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma skyes shing byung bar gyur te'o //
analyzed: rnam pa rtog pa sna tshogs skyes te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma skyes shing byung bar gyur te'o //
translated: Various thoughts arise means that many kinds of thoughts arise and occur.

original: bslab pa'i dus las zhes bya ba @99a * //
analyzed: bslab pa'i dus las zhes bya ba @99a * //
translated: From the time of training means from the time of the precepts.

original: ni bslab pa'i mtshams las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: ni bslab pa'i mtshams las 'das pa yin te /
translated: He transgresses the limits of training.

original: bya ba ma yin pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does what should not be done.

original: slu bar 'dod pa ni rnam par bgrod par 'dod pa ste lam ma yin pa la 'jug par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: slu bar 'dod pa ni rnam par bgrod par 'dod pa ste lam ma yin pa la 'jug par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desiring to deceive means desiring to go astray, desiring to enter a non-path.

original: de'i rang gi rnag bzhin ni sbrul gyi lus su ste /
analyzed: de'i rang gi rnag bzhin ni sbrul gyi lus su ste /
translated: His own nature is the body of a snake.

original: 'di ltar de'i lus sngon gyi nyes par spyad pas thob pa ae la'i shing skyes pas nye bar mtshon pa mgo bo de shog shig la ni skye ba'i tshogs chen po skyo ba bskyed pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyi de skad du gsung pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i lus sngon gyi nyes par spyad pas thob pa ae la'i shing skyes pas nye bar mtshon pa mgo bo de shog shig la ni skye ba'i tshogs chen po skyo ba bskyed pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyi de skad du gsung pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One said this in order to generate great disgust for the body, which is obtained through previous misconduct, and which is characterized by the tree of Airammadana.

original: rnag dang khrag 'dzag pa ni kun nas 'dzag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnag dang khrag 'dzag pa ni kun nas 'dzag par gyur pa'o //
translated: Pus and blood flow from it.

original: rnag dang khrag khyad par ji lta bu zhe na //
analyzed: rnag dang khrag khyad par ji lta bu zhe na //
translated: What is the difference between pus and blood?

original: srin bu'i rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: srin bu'i rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œfilled with many kinds of worms,â€ and so on.

original: srin bu'i rigs brgya phag du mas gang ba dang / sbrang bu'i tshogs du ma 'phur zhing 'bab pas khyab par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: srin bu'i rigs brgya phag du mas gang ba dang / sbrang bu'i tshogs du ma 'phur zhing 'bab pas khyab par gyur pa ste /
translated: It is filled with many kinds of worms, and with many swarms of flies flying and falling.

original: 'phur ba ni steng du lding ba yin la /
analyzed: 'phur ba ni steng du lding ba yin la /
translated: Flying means hovering above.

original: 'bab pa ni 'og tu ltung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bab pa ni 'og tu ltung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Falling means descending below.

original: rab tu mnam pa ni rnag dang khrag shin tu dring bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu mnam pa ni rnag dang khrag shin tu dring bar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: bltas na mi sdug pa'o zhes bya ba ni bltas pa'i sgo nas 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: shin tu 'jigs su rung ba zhes bya ba ni 'jigs par byed pa dang smad par bya ba'i gnas yin no //

original: gas pa ni bags pa gas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gas pa ni bags pa gas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase it is cracked means that it is cracked on the surface.

original: rtsub pa ni reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lung ston par mi mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir rgyud brjod par bya ba yin te /

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: 'tsho ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yin no //

original: ka tya ya na'i rgyud yin pas na zhes bya ba ni drang srong ka tya ya na de'i drung du skyes pas na ka tya ya na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ka tya ya na'i rgyud yin pas na zhes bya ba ni drang srong ka tya ya na de'i drung du skyes pas na ka tya ya na zhes bya'o //
translated: The term of Katyayana means that it is the Tantra of the sage Katyayana. He is called Katyayana because he was born in the presence of that sage.

original: 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la brten te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brten pa rnam pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la brten te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brten pa rnam pa gang gis she na /
translated: As for the statement this world is based on two, etc., on what basis is it based?

original: yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says existence and non-existence, etc.

original: yod pa ni rtag par lta ba yin la /
analyzed: yod pa ni rtag par lta ba yin la /
translated: Existence is the view of permanence, and

original: med pa nyid ni chad par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid ni chad par lta ba yin te /
translated: non-existence is the view of annihilation.

original: gcig ni rtag par smra ba yin zhing /
analyzed: gcig ni rtag par smra ba yin zhing /

analyzed: gcig ni chad par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: one is a proponent of annihilation. This is the meaning.

original: phal cher ni mang du ste /
analyzed: phal cher ni mang du ste /
translated: The term mostly means for the most part,

analyzed: thams cad de lta bu'i rnam pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: ci'i phyir yang de ltar rten par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang de ltar rten par byed ce na /

original: de'i phyir srung po dang nye bar len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten 'di dag ni phung po dang nye bar len pas zin pa de'i phyir gnyis la brten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because these worlds are seized by the aggregates and the appropriators, therefore they are called â€œdependent on the two.â€

original: phung po ni nyon mongs pa ma gtogs par skye ba'i phung po la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: phung po ni nyon mongs pa ma gtogs par skye ba'i phung po la sogs pa yin la /

original: nye bar len pa ni nyon mongs pa yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni nyon mongs pa yin te /

original: phung po dang nye bar len pa ni phung po dang nye bar len pa ste /ğŸ”½de dag gis zin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: phung po dang nye bar len pa ni phung po dang nye bar len pa ste / de dag gis zin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'am /

original: khyab par gyur pa'o//
analyzed: khyab par gyur pa'o//
translated: Or, pervaded by them.

translated: Thus, they are not at all means that the two internal ones are not at all.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: smras pa / sems kyi gnas dang mngon par zhen pa'i bag la nyal ni 'di ltar yul dag la 'dis 'di ni bdag nyid kyi'o zhes lhag par gnas pas na gnas te srid pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / sems kyi gnas dang mngon par zhen pa'i bag la nyal ni 'di ltar yul dag la 'dis 'di ni bdag nyid kyi'o zhes lhag par gnas pas na gnas te srid pa yin no //
translated: It is said: The latent impressions of the mindâ€™s abode and attachment are as follows: since this is the selfâ€™s, it abides in the objects. Abiding means existence.

original: mngon par zhen pa smos pas lta ba dag bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa smos pas lta ba dag bzung ba yin no //
translated: The mention of â€œadherenceâ€ includes the views.

original: nye bar mi 'gro ba ni 'di ltar de dag la bdag nyid kyis 'gro bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mi 'gro ba ni 'di ltar de dag la bdag nyid kyis 'gro bar mi byed pa'o //

original: nye bar mi len to zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mi len to zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par mi byed pa'o //
translated: â€œDo not take upâ€ means that they do not grasp.

original: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan por mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan por mi byed pa'o //
translated: â€œDo not remainâ€ means that they do not remain firmly.

original: mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par mi byed pa'o //

analyzed: bdag med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate selflessness, he says â€œsuffering.â€

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal tsam kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal tsam kho na yin gyi /
translated: This is merely suffering;

original: bdag dang bdag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not a self or anything pertaining to a self.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi zhes bya ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi zhes bya ba'i yul lo //
translated: â€œIn this regardâ€ refers to the realm of suffering.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod par byed pas so //

analyzed: the tshom du gyur pas zhes bya ba ni the tshom byed pas so //
translated: â€œDoubtâ€ means that which is doubted.

original: phyogs gnyis thos nas gang zhig yid ches pa ni mngon par 'dod pa skyes par gyur pa /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis thos nas gang zhig yid ches pa ni mngon par 'dod pa skyes par gyur pa /
translated: Having heard both sides, one generates a conviction as to which is the preferred position.

original: de ni 'dir 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'dir 'dod pa yin la /
translated: That is the preferred position here.

original: ji de ltar yin nam 'on te de ltar ma yin /
analyzed: ji de ltar yin nam 'on te de ltar ma yin /
translated: But is it so or is it not so?

original: zhes dogs pa ni the tshom du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes dogs pa ni the tshom du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Such a doubt is a doubt.

original: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis shes pa kho na ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rim gyis des pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir gzhan la rag las pa ma yin pa'i shes pa grub par gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis shes pa kho na ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rim gyis des pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir gzhan la rag las pa ma yin pa'i shes pa grub par gyur te /
translated: It is not only through the conditions of another that one knows, because the knowledge of the truth gradually arises through oneself. Thus, the knowledge that is not dependent on another is established.

original: bdag nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i sgo nas mngon sum du byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i sgo nas mngon sum du byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is made manifest through the manifestation of the self.

original: yang na 'di la ka tya ya na khyod 'dod pa dang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na 'di la ka tya ya na khyod 'dod pa dang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, in this context, â€œYou, KÄtyÄyana, do not know through the conditions of another and through desire.â€

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'dod pa dang the tshom du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'dod pa dang the tshom du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Desire and doubt are suffering and so forth.

original: yul de la the tshom du gyur pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul de la the tshom du gyur pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because doubt is abandoned with regard to that object.

original: de bas na shes pa na de la nges par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa na de la nges par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, when it is understood, it is ascertained, and

original: gzhan la rag lus par gyur pa nyid ma yin no //ğŸ”½'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di tsam gyis 'di ltar bden pa phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan la rag lus par gyur pa nyid ma yin no // 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di tsam gyis 'di ltar bden pa phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa'i phyir /
translated: it is not dependent on another.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba yin no //
translated: â€œ Just this muchâ€ and so on. Just this much is the correct view because of the non-erroneous understanding of the truth in this way.

original: 'di tsam la yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa'i lta bar tha snyad btags pa ste /
analyzed: 'di tsam la yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa'i lta bar tha snyad btags pa ste /
translated: The TathÄgata has designated just this much as the correct view.

original: @100b tha snyad du mdzad cing rnam par gzhag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: @100b tha snyad du mdzad cing rnam par gzhag pa mdzad do //
translated: He has made a convention, he has made a presentation.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is that? means â€œfrom what?â€

original: 'jig rten gyi kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yin la 'jig rten de'i kun 'byung ba ni rab tu skye ba'o //ğŸ”½de yang dag pa ji lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yin la 'jig rten de'i kun 'byung ba ni rab tu skye ba'o // de yang dag pa ji lta ba ste /
translated: â€œ The origin of the worldâ€ and so on. The world is the five appropriated aggregates. The origin of that world is its arising.ğŸ”½That is the suchness,

original: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: just as it is.

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis bltas shing yongs su gcad par byas par gyur na'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyis bltas shing yongs su gcad par byas par gyur na'o //
translated: â€œBy means of right wisdomâ€ means by means of uncontaminated wisdom.

original: 'jig rten ni med pa nyid do zhes chad pa gang yin pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni med pa nyid do zhes chad pa gang yin pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: The world is not non-existent, as in annihilationism.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni nye par len pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi chos kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni nye par len pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi chos kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin la /
translated: Because it is suffering, since it is the effect of the dharmas that have the five aggregates as their nature.

original: 'di las kun 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kun 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba yin te /
translated: And it is the origin, since it is the cause of the future, in the sense that everything originates from it.

analyzed: phung po lnga po 'di las gzhan dang de las gzhan du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i phyir med pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: Since one is born from these five aggregates into another set of five aggregates, it is not non-existent.
