analyzed: rigs ldan zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'jam pa'o //
translated: Noble means naturally gentle.

original: byis pa dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byis pa dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With children, etc.

original: byis pa ni 'dir byis pa'i khye'u'o //
analyzed: byis pa ni 'dir byis pa'i khye'u'o //
translated: The child here is a young boy.

original: sprul ni brang 'gro'o //
analyzed: sprul ni brang 'gro'o //
translated: The snake is a reptile.

original: gnod byed ma ni skyes bu gzhan la rab tu chags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod byed ma ni skyes bu gzhan la rab tu chags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The harmful woman is one who is very attached to another man.

original: mi brten pa ni gang dga' ba yun ring du 'dzin par mi byed pa'am /ğŸ”½cig shos dga' ba ste /
analyzed: mi brten pa ni gang dga' ba yun ring du 'dzin par mi byed pa'am / cig shos dga' ba ste /
translated: The unreliable is one who does not hold to his pleasure for long.

original: tha mal pa sten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa sten par byed pa'o //
translated: The other is one who is pleased with the ordinary.

original: dpa' bo ni 'dir g-yul dogs su dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni 'dir g-yul dogs su dga' ba'o //
translated: The hero here is one who delights in battle.

original: gang la zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gang la zhe na smras pa /
translated: To whom? It is said:

original: shin tu gnod par gyur pa dang shin tu nyam nga bar zhugs pa'i sems can la'o //
analyzed: shin tu gnod par gyur pa dang shin tu nyam nga bar zhugs pa'i sems can la'o //
translated: To the sentient beings who are greatly harmed and who have entered into great danger.

original: gtam mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyod dang gtam mi bya'o //
analyzed: gtam mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyod dang gtam mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak with him means: one should not speak with him.

original: sbyin pa ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Not seeing generosity, etc. means:

original: skyes bu gang zhig la 'ga' zhig gis sbyin pa ma mthong ba de ni 'dir zhe sdang tshul du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zhig la 'ga' zhig gis sbyin pa ma mthong ba de ni 'dir zhe sdang tshul du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The person who does not see generosity here is one who is angry.

original: phrod @110b pa mi byed pa ni gang zhig rtag tu pha rol po la 'gal ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: phrod @110b pa mi byed pa ni gang zhig rtag tu pha rol po la 'gal ba spyod pa'o //
translated: Not being friendly is one who always acts in opposition to others.

original: mi mthong spyod pa ni gang zhig 'ga' zhig la rjes su mthun par mi spyod cing /
analyzed: mi mthong spyod pa ni gang zhig 'ga' zhig la rjes su mthun par mi spyod cing /
translated: The practice of not seeing is the practice of not following the rules for some people,

original: gzhan la rtag tu nye bar spyod pa sgrogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rtag tu nye bar spyod pa sgrogs par byed pa'o //
translated: but always practicing them for others.

original: sbyin pa byin nas yang rim gyis dbri ba nas thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyin par mi byed pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin nas yang rim gyis dbri ba nas thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyin par mi byed pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Having given a gift, one gradually reduces it, until one finally gives nothing at all.

original: gnas brtan ni 'dir lo bcu lon par 'dod la /
analyzed: gnas brtan ni 'dir lo bcu lon par 'dod la /
translated: Here, an elder is one who has ten years seniority.

original: rgan pa yang lus rnyings par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgan pa yang lus rnyings par gyur pa'o //
translated: An old person is one whose body is worn out.

original: tshig ngan ni gang pha rol smra ba brnag par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ngan ni gang pha rol smra ba brnag par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Bad words are those that cannot be endured by others.

original: smyin thabs ni dig thabs su smra ba ni shin tu khros pa nyid kyi phyir ro //ğŸ”½ba spu gyen du bgreng ba ni ba spu gyen du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: smyin thabs ni dig thabs su smra ba ni shin tu khros pa nyid kyi phyir ro // ba spu gyen du bgreng ba ni ba spu gyen du 'jug pa'o //
translated: A deceitful speech is one that is very angry.ğŸ”½Upright body hair is body hair that stands up.

original: bzhin ni gnyer mar ldan pa ni bzhin gnyer mas khyab par gyur pa can no //
analyzed: bzhin ni gnyer mar ldan pa ni bzhin gnyer mas khyab par gyur pa can no //
translated: A wrinkled face is a face that is covered with wrinkles.

original: kha spu chung ba ni kha spu byi ba'o //
analyzed: kha spu chung ba ni kha spu byi ba'o //
translated: A small beard is a beard that is shaved.

original: 'dod chags gcong can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dod chags gcong can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The one who is sick with passion, etc.

original: gang zhig lhag par 'dod chags kyi shas dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig lhag par 'dod chags kyi shas dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He who is endowed with a predominance of attachment.

original: don la sems pa ni gang zhig rtag tu nor sgrub pa'i thabs sems par byed pa dang / gang zhig tha snyad du byed pa'i sgo nas mngon par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: don la sems pa ni gang zhig rtag tu nor sgrub pa'i thabs sems par byed pa dang / gang zhig tha snyad du byed pa'i sgo nas mngon par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: He who is intent on the meaning is one who is always intent on the means of acquiring wealth and one who applies himself by means of conventional expressions.

original: 'dzags pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dam pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzags pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dam pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The leaking one is the one who is not a holy being.

original: sel ba ni thog 'bab pa dang bcas pa'i ser pa'o //
analyzed: sel ba ni thog 'bab pa dang bcas pa'i ser pa'o //
translated: The dissipating one is the one who is distracted.

original: mi rtag pa ni skad cig mas mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni skad cig mas mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: The impermanent one is the one who is impermanent by moment.

original: don med par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni don 'jig par 'dod pa dang 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du phan pa ma yin pa byed pas na phan par mi 'dod pa dang bde bar mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba skyes pağŸ”½'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: don med par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni don 'jig par 'dod pa dang 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du phan pa ma yin pa byed pas na phan par mi 'dod pa dang bde bar mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba skyes pa 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is without purpose is the one who is without purpose in the world. The one who is without benefit is the one who does not benefit in this world and the next. The one who is without happiness is the one who destroys arisen happiness.

original: reg par mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa skyes pa dang gegs byed pa'o //
analyzed: reg par mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa skyes pa dang gegs byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is without contact is the one who obstructs the non-arisen from arising.ğŸ”½ The one who is without satisfaction is the one who is not satisfied with the arisen.

original: grub pa dang bde bar mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde bar mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: They do not desire success and happiness.

original: ma thob pa ni grub pa yin la /
analyzed: ma thob pa ni grub pa yin la /
translated: Non-acquisition is success.

original: yon tan rnyed pa yongs su skyong bar byed pa bde ba yin te /
analyzed: yon tan rnyed pa yongs su skyong bar byed pa bde ba yin te /
translated: The preservation of acquired virtues is happiness.

original: de yang ma thob pa mi thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / rnyed pa 'jig par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //ğŸ”½byas zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus yin la byed pa ni da ltar gyi dus yin zhing /
analyzed: de yang ma thob pa mi thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / rnyed pa 'jig par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no // byas zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus yin la byed pa ni da ltar gyi dus yin zhing /
translated: They are engaged in the non-acquisition of non-acquisition and the destruction of acquisition.

original: byed par 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: byed par 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus yin no //
translated: The past is called â€œdoneâ€; the present, â€œbeing doneâ€; and the future, â€œwill be done.â€

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin du zin kyang yang dang yang du smra bas na bya rog dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin du zin kyang yang dang yang du smra bas na bya rog dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Even though they are mistaken, they speak again and again, so they are like crows.

original: mang du @111a * //
analyzed: mang du @111a * //
translated: They speak much

original: don med par smra ba'i phyir mu cor smra ba yin la /
analyzed: don med par smra ba'i phyir mu cor smra ba yin la /
translated: and their speech is incoherent, so they are like parrots.ğŸ”½They speak much and their speech is meaningless, so they are like mynah birds.

original: yang dang yang du 'brel pa med pa mi gsal ba smra ba'i phyir ca cor smra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'brel pa med pa mi gsal ba smra ba'i phyir ca cor smra ba'o //
translated: They speak again and again with no connection, unclearly, so they are like babblers.

original: sog pa zhes bya ba ni sog par byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: sog pa zhes bya ba ni sog par byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: They are like reeds, for they have the nature of being hollow.

original: skad 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni don med pa'i skad sgrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skad 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni don med pa'i skad sgrog par byed pa'o //
translated: The making of sounds is the making of meaningless sounds.

original: rigs par mi byed pa ni 'dir phyin ci log gi rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: rigs par mi byed pa ni 'dir phyin ci log gi rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The not doing what is proper is a synonym for the not doing what is right.

original: lho ngos su song zhes bya ba ni lho phyogs su 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir lho ngos su song ba dang gam du song bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lho ngos su song zhes bya ba ni lho phyogs su 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir lho ngos su song ba dang gam du song bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The going to the south is the going to the south, the going to the vicinity, because of going to the south.

original: 'od ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: 'od ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The light is the sun.

original: mes tshig pa la zhes bya ba la yang bkra mi shis pa'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas yang me'i nang du bcug nas sreg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mes tshig pa la zhes bya ba la yang bkra mi shis pa'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas yang me'i nang du bcug nas sreg par byed pa'o //
translated: The being burned by fire is also inauspicious, and so, in this case, it is the being put into the fire and burned.

original: zos pa ni bza' bar bya zhing longs spyad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zos pa ni bza' bar bya zhing longs spyad par bya ba'o //
translated: The eating is the eating and enjoying.

original: 'thungs pa ni btung ba'o //
analyzed: 'thungs pa ni btung ba'o //
translated: The drinking is the drinking.

original: bca' ba ni bca' bar bya'o //
analyzed: bca' ba ni bca' bar bya'o //
translated: The chewing is the chewing.

original: myangs pa ni aa mra la sogs pa gzhib par bya ba'o //
analyzed: myangs pa ni aa mra la sogs pa gzhib par bya ba'o //
translated: The sucking is the sucking of mangoes and so on.

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shes par bya ba'i yul 'ga' zhig la chags pa med pa'i thogs pa med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shes par bya ba'i yul 'ga' zhig la chags pa med pa'i thogs pa med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The phrase â€œunimpeded intuitionâ€ and so on means that unimpeded intuition is not attached to any object of knowledge.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with â€œomniscient intuition.â€

original: de nyid stobs yin te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das stobs des 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid stobs yin te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das stobs des 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: That itself is power, and the Lord Buddha is the universal monarch by that power.

original: de'i stobs bcu dang ldan pas na khyu mchog gi gnas rgya chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /ğŸ”½sems rgya chen po la brten par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rgya chen po nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i stobs bcu dang ldan pas na khyu mchog gi gnas rgya chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / sems rgya chen po la brten par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rgya chen po nyid yin la /
translated: Since he possesses the ten powers, the verse speaks of â€œthe universal monarchâ€™s great abode,â€ and so on.ğŸ”½It is great because it is the basis of the great mind.

original: 'di khyu mchog gi yin pas na khyu mchog gi'o //
analyzed: 'di khyu mchog gi yin pas na khyu mchog gi'o //
translated: Since it is the universal monarchâ€™s, it is the universal monarchâ€™s abode.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: smras pa / gnas ni go 'phang zhes bya ba'i don yin te ;
analyzed: smras pa / gnas ni go 'phang zhes bya ba'i don yin te ;
translated: It is said that the meaning of â€œabodeâ€ is â€œstate.â€

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan par mdzad pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i go 'phang zhal gyis bzhes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan par mdzad pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i go 'phang zhal gyis bzhes par gyur pa'o //
translated: He has attained the fearless stage that is taught by the unsurpassed, perfect, complete Buddha.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad cing zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad cing zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: He turns the Brahma wheel means he turns the wheel of the noble path.

original: yang dag par seng ge'i sgra sgrogs so zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can thams cad skrag par byed cing bdag med par gsal bar byed pa'i bka' sgrogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par seng ge'i sgra sgrogs so zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can thams cad skrag par byed cing bdag med par gsal bar byed pa'i bka' sgrogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He roars the true lionâ€™s roar means he proclaims the teaching that frightens all the tÄ«rthikas and makes them clear that there is no self.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnas ni srid pa yin la gnas med pa ni mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnas ni srid pa yin la gnas med pa ni mi srid pa yin te /
translated: As for the possible and the impossible, and so on, the possible is existence, and the impossible is nonexistence.

original: lus la @111b sogs pa'i dge ba las 'bras bu 'dod pa ni srid pa yin la mi 'dod pa ni mi srid pa yin zhing dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa ma yin pa ni mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: lus la @111b sogs pa'i dge ba las 'bras bu 'dod pa ni srid pa yin la mi 'dod pa ni mi srid pa yin zhing dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa ma yin pa ni mi srid pa yin te /
translated: It is possible that the result of virtuous actions such as the body is desired, but it is impossible that it is not desired. It is impossible that the result of virtuous actions is not desired.

original: 'dod pa ni srid pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni srid pa dag yin no //
translated: Desire is the craving for existence.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bya ba ni de khon nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ste phyin ci ma log pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bya ba ni de khon nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ste phyin ci ma log pa nyid du'o //
translated: One knows them as they are in reality means that one knows them as they are in reality, without error.

original: las dang chos yang dag par blangs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la las ni rnam pa gsum ste /ğŸ”½lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rang bzhin no //ğŸ”½de'i dbye ba bzhi las yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ste /ğŸ”½ji skad du las nag po dang rnam par smin pa nag po dang / dge ba dang rnam par smin pa dge ba dang / gnag la dge ba dang rnam par smin pa gnag la dge ba dang / gnag pa ma yin la dge ba dang rnam par smin pa gnag pa ma yin la dge ba yod do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: las dang chos yang dag par blangs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la las ni rnam pa gsum ste / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rang bzhin no // de'i dbye ba bzhi las yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ste / ji skad du las nag po dang rnam par smin pa nag po dang / dge ba dang rnam par smin pa dge ba dang / gnag la dge ba dang rnam par smin pa gnag la dge ba dang / gnag pa ma yin la dge ba dang rnam par smin pa gnag pa ma yin la dge ba yod do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The phrase the correct undertaking of action and the correct undertaking of Dharma and so on. Action is of three kinds:ğŸ”½The correct undertaking of action is the fourfold division of that action, as stated in the sutra: There is black action with black retribution, there is white action with white retribution, there is black and white action with black and white retribution, and there is action that is neither black nor white with neither black nor white retribution.

original: chos yang dag par blangs pa la ni rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos yang dag par blangs pa la ni rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: The correct undertaking of Dharma is the fourfold division of Dharma, as stated in the sutra: There is Dharma that is agreeable but not beneficial, there is Dharma that is beneficial but not agreeable, there is Dharma that is both agreeable and beneficial, and there is Dharma that is neither agreeable nor beneficial.

original: chos yang dag par blangs pa da ltar bde ba ma 'ongs pa rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yod pa dang / chos yang dag par blangs pa da ltar sdug bsngal zhing ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa bde ba yod pa dang /
analyzed: chos yang dag par blangs pa da ltar bde ba ma 'ongs pa rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yod pa dang / chos yang dag par blangs pa da ltar sdug bsngal zhing ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa bde ba yod pa dang /
translated: There is the taking up of a Dharma that is pleasant in the present but has a result that is suffering in the future,ğŸ”½there is the taking up of a Dharma that is suffering in the present and has a result that is pleasant in the future,ğŸ”½there is the taking up of a Dharma that is suffering in the present and has a result that is suffering in the future,

original: chos yang dag par blangs pa da ltar sdug bsngal zhing ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal yod pa dang / chos yang dag par blangs pa da ltar bde zhing ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa bde ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: chos yang dag par blangs pa da ltar sdug bsngal zhing ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal yod pa dang / chos yang dag par blangs pa da ltar bde zhing ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa bde ba yod pa yin te /
translated: and there is the taking up of a Dharma that is pleasant in the present and has a result that is pleasant in the future.

original: rnam par smin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the ripening of karma exactly as it is.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dus te /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dus te /
translated: The time of this is called the â€œabode.â€ğŸ”½

original: tshogs pa 'ga' zhig yod na las dang chos yang dag par blangs pa gang dag gi 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ro zhes de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: tshogs pa 'ga' zhig yod na las dang chos yang dag par blangs pa gang dag gi 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ro zhes de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Dwellingâ€ refers to the time when, if there is a certain collection, the result of the taking up of a Dharma and karma will be produced. He knows that exactly as it is.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni rten yin te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni rten yin te /
translated: The term entity refers to the basis.ğŸ”½If there is some basis for the transmigration of gods and so on, then their effects would definitely arise from them.

original: lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rten 'ga' zhig yod na de dag las nges par 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu ji snyed pa dang rkyen ji snyed pa de yod na 'bras bu'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rten 'ga' zhig yod na de dag las nges par 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu ji snyed pa dang rkyen ji snyed pa de yod na 'bras bu'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The term cause refers to the extent of causes and conditions, for if they exist, the activity of the effect occurs.

original: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /ğŸ”½bsam gtan ni dang po la @112a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / bsam gtan ni dang po la @112a * //
translated: The term meditative concentration, liberation, and so on refers to

original: sogs pa bzhi yin la /
analyzed: sogs pa bzhi yin la /
translated: the four meditative concentrations, beginning with the first,

original: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad yin no //
translated: and the eight liberations.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three meditative absorptions:ğŸ”½emptiness,ğŸ”½signlessness, and

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
translated: wishlessness.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni gzugs med pa bzhi dag yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni gzugs med pa bzhi dag yin no //
translated: There are four meditative attainments: the four meditative states of the formless realm.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i gegs yin te /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i gegs yin te /
translated: Among them, affliction is an obstruction to meditative attainment.

original: chos dag 'di'i bgegs su 'gyur ba'i phyir srid par 'gyur ba'o //ğŸ”½rnam par gnas pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa gnas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos dag 'di'i bgegs su 'gyur ba'i phyir srid par 'gyur ba'o // rnam par gnas pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa gnas par byed pa ste /
translated: and the Dharma is the basis for the arising of existence because it obstructs that.

original: chos gang dag gis 'di gnas par bya ba'i phyir srid par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos gang dag gis 'di gnas par bya ba'i phyir srid par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Stability is the basis for the meditative attainment of stability because it is the basis for the arising of existence.ğŸ”½Purification is the basis for the arising of existence because it is the basis for the purification of that.

original: rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni chos gang dag gis 'di rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir srid pa'i 'gyur ba gsum po de dag gis go rims bzhin du spangs pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni chos gang dag gis 'di rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir srid pa'i 'gyur ba gsum po de dag gis go rims bzhin du spangs pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: These three types of existence are, respectively, the three types of conditions conducive to elimination, stability, and distinction.

original: de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He perfectly knows the faculties of sentient beings.

original: sems can gang zag gi rnam grangs yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang zag gi rnam grangs yin la /
translated: Sentient beings are a synonym for individuals.

original: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: He perfectly knows the supreme and not supreme faculties.

original: mchog ni khyad par du 'phags pa yin zhing mchog ma yin pa ni dman pa yin te /
analyzed: mchog ni khyad par du 'phags pa yin zhing mchog ma yin pa ni dman pa yin te /
translated: Supreme means exalted, and non-supreme means inferior.

original: sems can 'di ni dbang po rtul ba yin la /ğŸ”½'di dbang po 'bring yin /
analyzed: sems can 'di ni dbang po rtul ba yin la / 'di dbang po 'bring yin /
translated: This sentient being has dull faculties,ğŸ”½this one has middling faculties,

original: 'di ni dbang po rnon po yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po rnon po yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and this one has sharp faculties.

original: dbang po yang 'dir dad pa la sogs pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: dbang po yang 'dir dad pa la sogs pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: And here, the faculties are asserted to be faith and so on.

original: mos pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni mos pa ni 'dod pa dang mngon par bsams pa zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni mos pa ni 'dod pa dang mngon par bsams pa zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
translated: Various inclinations means inclinations are the meaning of desire and aspiration.

original: sems can rnams kyi mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa de yang de kho na nyid du ji lta ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig gis mkhyen par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag gis ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa de yang de kho na nyid du ji lta ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig gis mkhyen par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag gis ma yin no //
translated: The various types of inclinations of sentient beings are known by the BhagavÄn alone just as they are, but not by others.

original: khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khams ni bsam pa dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khams ni bsam pa dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don yin la /
translated: Various constituents means constituents are the meaning of intention and nature.

original: de yang sems can dag gis skye ba gzhan du goms pa'i dbang gis de sems can so so'i rgyud kyi dbye ba las khams sna tshogs zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sems can dag gis skye ba gzhan du goms pa'i dbang gis de sems can so so'i rgyud kyi dbye ba las khams sna tshogs zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is due to the power of practice in other lives that it is said to be various in the individual lifestreams of sentient beings.

original: gcig la yang khams du ma srid pa'i phyir khams du ma zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig la yang khams du ma srid pa'i phyir khams du ma zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: It is said to be manifold because many elements are possible in one lifestream.

original: thams cad @112b du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad de yul thams cad du 'gro ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na de la 'di thams cad du 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: thams cad @112b du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad de yul thams cad du 'gro ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na de la 'di thams cad du 'gro ba yin la /
translated: The path of universal application is so called because it is the path that leads to the realization of the specific categories of entities.

original: dngos po'i bye brag 'dis rtogs par byed pa'i phyir lam yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i bye brag 'dis rtogs par byed pa'i phyir lam yin te /
translated: It is the path because it causes the realization of the specific categories of entities.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba yang 'di yin la lam yang yin pas na thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mo ;
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba yang 'di yin la lam yang yin pas na thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mo ;
translated: It is the path of universal application because it is both the path and that which leads to the realization of all.

original: / de yang ye shes yin te /
analyzed: / de yang ye shes yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is intuition.

original: de 'dir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de 'dir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: It is the correct knowledge of that as it is.

original: sngon gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi skye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi skye ba'i gnas so //
translated: Previous abodes refers to previous births.

original: 'jig pa'i bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase â€œthe eon of destructionâ€ and so on.

original: 'jig pa'i bskal pa ni sems cad dmyal ba mi srid pa'i phyir snod 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bskal pa ni sems cad dmyal ba mi srid pa'i phyir snod 'jig pa yin la /
translated: The eon of destruction is the destruction of the world because it is impossible for sentient beings to exist in the hells.

original: 'chags pa'i bskal pa ni thog mar rlung nas dmyal ba'i bar du srid par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'chags pa'i bskal pa ni thog mar rlung nas dmyal ba'i bar du srid par gyur pa'o //
translated: The eon of creation is the creation of the world up to the creation of the hells.

original: 'jig pa ni nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni nyams pa yin te /
translated: Destruction is the decrease of the world.

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa gcig tu gnas shing 'dus par byed pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½'chags pa yang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'o//
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa gcig tu gnas shing 'dus par byed pa'i phyir ro // 'chags pa yang 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'o//
translated: Because it causes the minds of sentient beings to be unified and to come together.ğŸ”½Creation is the arising of the world.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe sentient being named so-and-soâ€ and so on.

original: ming 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ming ni chos sbyin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ming ni chos sbyin la sogs pa'o //
translated: Name refers to Dharmadatta and so on.

original: rus ni bram ze la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rus ni bram ze la sogs pa'o //
translated: Lineage refers to brahmin and so on.

original: rigs ni goo ta ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni goo ta ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Caste refers to Gautama and so on.

original: kha zas ni chang zan gyi rnam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha zas ni chang zan gyi rnam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Food refers to the form of food that is eaten by mouthfuls and so on.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni nyams su myong ba'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni nyams su myong ba'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: Pleasure and pain refer to the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: dus ring por 'tsho ba'i phyir tshe ring ba'o //
analyzed: dus ring por 'tsho ba'i phyir tshe ring ba'o //
translated: Long life refers to a long life.

original: byis pa'i gnas skabs la sogs pa'i dus ring por gnas pa'i phyir yun ring du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i gnas skabs la sogs pa'i dus ring por gnas pa'i phyir yun ring du gnas pa'o //
translated: It is long-lasting because it endures for a long time, for the period of childhood, etc.

original: ji srid du tshe 'phags par gnas pa'i phyir 'di ltar de'i tshe'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid du tshe 'phags par gnas pa'i phyir 'di ltar de'i tshe'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: It is the limit of life because it is the end of life.

original: 'dis ni bar ma dor 'chi ba med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bar ma dor 'chi ba med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that there is no premature death.

original: gnas dang bcas pa ni yul dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa ni yul dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by a place, i.e., by a country.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni ming dang dus la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni ming dang dus la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: It is accompanied by a form, i.e., by a name, a time, etc.

original: lha'i mig ces bya ba la ci lha'i mig spyi 'am 'on te ma yin zhe na /ğŸ”½smras pa / rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig ces bya ba la ci lha'i mig spyi 'am 'on te ma yin zhe na / smras pa / rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The divine eye is of two kinds:

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is pure, i.e., it is obtained through meditation, but not innate.

original: mi'i las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i mi la skyer rung ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi'i las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i mi la skyer rung ba nyid kyis so //
translated: It is beyond the human, i.e., it is capable of arising in a human being who is distinguished.

original: kha dog bzang po zhes bya ba ni mdangs mdzes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog bzang po zhes bya ba ni mdangs mdzes par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is beautiful, i.e., it is brilliant.

original: kha dog ngan pa ni mdangs mdzes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kha dog ngan pa ni mdangs mdzes pa ma yin no //
translated: An ugly color is not a beautiful luster.

original: dman pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang @113a * //ğŸ”½mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang @113a * // mi ldan pa'o //
translated: Inferior means not having merit.

original: gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: Excellent means having merit.

original: las ji lta bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la spyod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: las ji lta bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la spyod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Enjoyment according to one's karma means enjoying the fruit of karma that one has oneself created.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon brjod pa ni skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon brjod pa ni skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Falsely ascribing faults is slander.

original: log par lta ba'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la log par lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi las dang // chos yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la log par lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi las dang // chos yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The action of wrong view, etc. means the action that is preceded by wrong view, and the cause of taking up a false doctrine.

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i las dang / chos yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i las dang / chos yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of that means the action that causes wrong view to occur, and the cause of taking up a false doctrine.

original: de'i rkyen ni de nyid dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen ni de nyid dang 'dra'o //
translated: The condition of that is the same as that.

original: lus dang bral ba ste 'jig cing shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song la sogs par skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang bral ba ste 'jig cing shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song la sogs par skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: After death, after the destruction of the body, one is reborn in the lower realms.

original: ngan par song bas na ngan song ste /
analyzed: ngan par song bas na ngan song ste /
translated: The lower realms are the lower destinies.

original: dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dgas yin la /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dgas yin la /
translated: They are the hells, the animal realm, and the world of Yama.

original: de nyid smad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ngan 'gro yin zhing /
analyzed: de nyid smad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ngan 'gro yin zhing /
translated: They are lower destinies because they are to be despised.

original: log par ltung ba'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid log par ltung ba yin no //
analyzed: log par ltung ba'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid log par ltung ba yin no //
translated: They are lower rebirths because they are the places of falling.

original: sems can dmyal ba smos pas dmyal ba re re bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba smos pas dmyal ba re re bzung ba yin no //
translated: The mention of the hells includes each of the lower realms.

original: ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba ni ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba ste de dag tu'o //
analyzed: ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba ni ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba ste de dag tu'o //
translated: The hells are the lower realms, the lower destinies, and the lower rebirths.

original: bde 'gro zhes bya ba la bde 'gro rnam pa gnyis yod na bde 'gro gang la bya zhe na /
analyzed: bde 'gro zhes bya ba la bde 'gro rnam pa gnyis yod na bde 'gro gang la bya zhe na /
translated: If there are two kinds of happy realms, which happy realm is meant here?

original: mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The text says, â€œthe world of the gods.â€

original: de la yang kha cig tu gnas stong pa dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang kha cig tu gnas stong pa dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Some of them are born in empty abodes.

original: lha'i zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The word â€œgodsâ€ is mentioned.

original: zag pa zad pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs par gyur pa las so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs par gyur pa las so //
translated: From the destruction of the contaminants means from the abandonment of attachment and so on.

original: sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las 'grol bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las 'grol bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The mind is liberated means the mind is liberated from the bondage of the defilements.

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab ma rig pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab ma rig pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas so //
translated: Wisdom is liberated means wisdom is liberated from the ignorance and secondary defilements.

original: mthong ba'i chos kho na la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i skye pa la'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kho na la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i skye pa la'o //
translated: In this very life means in the present rebirth.

original: bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni lung phog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni lung phog pa med pa'o //
translated: By oneself means without being told.

original: mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis @113b so ;
analyzed: mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis @113b so ;
translated: By superknowledge means by knowledge.

original: / mngon sum du byas shing zhes bya bas ni the tshom med cing khong du chud cing ngo //
analyzed: / mngon sum du byas shing zhes bya bas ni the tshom med cing khong du chud cing ngo //
translated: Having realized means having realized without doubt.

original: zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni thag nye bar byas pa'am /
analyzed: zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni thag nye bar byas pa'am /
translated: â€œEmbarkingâ€ means having approached,

original: de gnyis dang ldan par gyur pa'am chen po nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis dang ldan par gyur pa'am chen po nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: or having become endowed with those two, or having understood their greatness.

original: rab tu shes pas na zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan gyis yongs su bcad nas so //
analyzed: rab tu shes pas na zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan gyis yongs su bcad nas so //
translated: â€œBy knowingâ€ means having discerned them by means of other knowledges.

original: nga'i skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba ni bdag gi skye ba'i srid pa rdzogs par gyur par ro //
analyzed: nga'i skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba ni bdag gi skye ba'i srid pa rdzogs par gyur par ro //
translated: â€œMy births are destroyedâ€ means that the existence of my births has been terminated.

original: skye ba'i srid pa zad pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa zad pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is the termination of the existence of births mentioned?

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten to zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten to zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: â€œThe pure life has been livedâ€ is stated.

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Brahma is nirvana.

original: de la gang gis spyod pa de ni tshangs par spyod pa ste lam yin te /
analyzed: de la gang gis spyod pa de ni tshangs par spyod pa ste lam yin te /
translated: That by which one lives in that is the pure life, which is the path.

original: de la bdag nyid thams cad kyis gnas par gyur pa ni bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid thams cad kyis gnas par gyur pa ni bsten pa yin no //
translated: Having lived in it with oneâ€™s entire being is living.

original: gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When one abides in the completion of the noble path, then all that is adverse is terminated.

original: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase having done what was to be done refers to the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa'i las kyi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa'i las kyi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase there is no more of this mundane existence means that there is no more result of action that would lead to another existence.ğŸ”½The phrase the king refers to the bodhisattva who is like a king. The phrase in every way refers to the Dharma that is appropriate for his own class and to the morality that is proper for him.

original: rgyal pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyal pos thams cad du rang gi rigs dang 'thad pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / tshul te tshul khrims gang yin pa de la brtag par bya zhing rjes su 'jug par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyal pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyal pos thams cad du rang gi rigs dang 'thad pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / tshul te tshul khrims gang yin pa de la brtag par bya zhing rjes su 'jug par bya ba yin no //
translated: He should investigate and follow that Dharma and morality.

original: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of that investigation and following?

original: 'jug dang rjes 'jug tshul du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jug dang rjes 'jug tshul du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text states that it is the nature of engagement and subsequent engagement.

original: rang bzhin gyis rjes su 'jug pa ni 'jug pa yin la snga mas 'di ltar byas pa de'i phyir bdag kyang rnam pa 'dis bya ba la rjes su 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rjes su 'jug pa ni 'jug pa yin la snga mas 'di ltar byas pa de'i phyir bdag kyang rnam pa 'dis bya ba la rjes su 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Engagement is the natural inclination to engage in virtue. Subsequent engagement is the thought Since he has acted in this way, I too should act in this way.

original: rgyal po bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyal po bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase the king who is patient refers to the bodhisattva who is like a king.

original: rgyal po bzod pa ni chos kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyal po bzod pa ni chos kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The kingâ€™s supreme dharma is patience.

original: lhas ba lang skyong gi ma'i nyes pa bzod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhas ba lang skyong gi ma'i nyes pa bzod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, you should be patient with the faults of the mother of Nanda the cowherd.

original: 'jig rten 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /ğŸ”½ji lta bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / ji lta bar bya ba ste /
translated: In this world, etc.

original: rin po che gang yin pa dang mnyam par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rin po che gang yin pa dang mnyam par bya ba ste /
translated: You should act as if you were equal to a jewel.

original: legs par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni khyod kyis ma mthong ba dang ma thos pa ste /
analyzed: legs par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni khyod kyis ma mthong ba dang ma thos pa ste /
translated: You have not seen or heard what is well-spoken.

original: mthong ba dang thos mod kyi zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos mod kyi zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: But you have seen and heard it, is what is meant.

original: de ltar na yang bdag gtso bo la dad pas cung zhig sdug pa dang mdza' ba @114a * //
analyzed: de ltar na yang bdag gtso bo la dad pas cung zhig sdug pa dang mdza' ba @114a * //
translated: Even so, because of faith in the chief, a little affection and trust arise.

original: dang yid brtan pa'i sgo nas rab tu khros pa nyes pa dang bcas pa ni sdug pas rab tu khros pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dang yid brtan pa'i sgo nas rab tu khros pa nyes pa dang bcas pa ni sdug pas rab tu khros pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should say that anger is due to affection.

original: bdag po'i brtul zhugs zhes bya ba la nye bar longs spyod pa la 'dir brtul zhugs kyi sgras brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag po'i brtul zhugs zhes bya ba la nye bar longs spyod pa la 'dir brtul zhugs kyi sgras brjod pa yin te /
translated: The term â€œvowâ€ here refers to enjoyment.

original: bdag po'i brtul zhugs gang la yod pa de ni 'dir bdag po'i brtul zhugs can te /
analyzed: bdag po'i brtul zhugs gang la yod pa de ni 'dir bdag po'i brtul zhugs can te /
translated: One who is a master of the vow is one who has the master's vow.

original: bud med la bdag po kho na longs spyod par byed kyi skyes bu gzhan dag ni ma yin pa de 'dir 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: bud med la bdag po kho na longs spyod par byed kyi skyes bu gzhan dag ni ma yin pa de 'dir 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning is that a woman is a master who enjoys only her own husband, not another man.

original: gzugs dang yon tan dang ldan zhes bya ba la yon tan smos pas 'dir sgyu rtsal la mkhas pa nyid bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang yon tan dang ldan zhes bya ba la yon tan smos pas 'dir sgyu rtsal la mkhas pa nyid bzung ba yin no //
translated: The phrase endowed with beauty and good qualities indicates that she is skilled in the arts.

original: chung ma yang me skor byas pa de bas na 'di cig car yongs su spang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chung ma yang me skor byas pa de bas na 'di cig car yongs su spang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since she is a wife, it is not proper to abandon her all at once.

original: rje'i phyir ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir khyed bdag gi rjer gyur pa de bas na bdag gis gdon mi za bar phan pa gsol ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rje'i phyir ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir khyed bdag gi rjer gyur pa de bas na bdag gis gdon mi za bar phan pa gsol ba yin gyi /
translated: For the sake of the master means because you are my master, I must certainly do what is beneficial for you,

original: bud med kyi rgyu mtshan gyis ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½don bzang po dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir legs par bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: bud med kyi rgyu mtshan gyis ni ma yin no // don bzang po dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir legs par bshad pa yin la /
translated: not for the sake of a woman.ğŸ”½It is well spoken because it has good meaning.

original: yi ge 'grel pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir legs par smras pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge 'grel pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir legs par smras pa'o //
translated: It is well expressed because it has good words.

original: ngas legs par smras pa khyod la yul ka n+ya kub dza sbyin zhing zhi la yang rnam pa thams cad kyis bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: ngas legs par smras pa khyod la yul ka n+ya kub dza sbyin zhing zhi la yang rnam pa thams cad kyis bzod par bya'o //
translated: I will give you the country of KÄnyakubja and I will also forgive you in every way.

original: 'du zhing 'dug pa'i khyim gang yin pa de ni 'du khang yin te /
analyzed: 'du zhing 'dug pa'i khyim gang yin pa de ni 'du khang yin te /
translated: The house where they gather is the assembly hall.

original: skye bo chen po 'du ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye bo chen po 'du ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is a place where a great many people gather.

original: 'dus pa ni tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus pa ni tshogs pa yin te /
translated: An assembly is a gathering.

original: las su bya ba'i don gcig kho na las 'dus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: las su bya ba'i don gcig kho na las 'dus par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is a gathering because of a single purpose, the thing to be done.

original: gtam la sogs pa zer ba ni gtam la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gtam la sogs pa zer ba ni gtam la 'jug pa'o //
translated: To engage in conversation, etc. is to engage in conversation.

original: dngos po 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa che ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa che ba'o //
translated: To have great desires is to desire things.

original: brtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of investigation means for the sake of examination.

original: mngon du bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
translated: To be realized means to be actualized.

original: rnam grangs du ma ni rnam pa du mas so //
analyzed: rnam grangs du ma ni rnam pa du mas so //
translated: In many ways means in many forms.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod pa ni rab tu dga' ba skyes pa dang rjes su mthun par ro //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod pa ni rab tu dga' ba skyes pa dang rjes su mthun par ro //
translated: To be fully encouraged is to be encouraged in accordance with the joy that has arisen.

original: yang dag par rab tu mgu ba ni sdug pa skyed par byed par ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu mgu ba ni sdug pa skyed par byed par ro //
translated: The word pleased means to generate affection.

original: byas nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par byas nas so //
analyzed: byas nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par byas nas so //
translated: Having done so means having completed it.

original: dul ba ma yin pa'i cha lugs 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rgod pa'i cha lugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dul ba ma yin pa'i cha lugs 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rgod pa'i cha lugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Having an undisciplined appearance means having a distracted appearance.

original: 'jam pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni ngag 'jam @114b pos so //ğŸ”½dbye ba'i sbyor bas zhes bya bas ni khyed cag 'di ltar mdzes par mi byed pa gang yin pa des ni khyed cag la mngon par dad pa rnams ma dad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni ngag 'jam @114b pos so // dbye ba'i sbyor bas zhes bya bas ni khyed cag 'di ltar mdzes par mi byed pa gang yin pa des ni khyed cag la mngon par dad pa rnams ma dad par 'gyur la /
translated: By the application of gentleness means by gentle speech.ğŸ”½By the application of division means by the words of division: Those who do not act in this way are not your followers.ğŸ”½Those who are not your followers will not have faith in you.

original: de dag ma dad pa las ni khyed cag gi bsod snyoms la sogs pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni 'byed pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de dag ma dad pa las ni khyed cag gi bsod snyoms la sogs pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni 'byed pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Those who do not have faith will not give you alms and so on.

original: mi mdzes par byas pa ni log par zhugs pa'o //ğŸ”½yan lag ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mdzes par byas pa ni log par zhugs pa'o // yan lag ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having an unattractive appearance means having an appearance of wrong practice.ğŸ”½The major parts are the arms and so on.

original: nying lag ni sor mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nying lag ni sor mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The minor parts are the fingers and so on.

original: zin pa ni skyes bu'i sems 'dzin pa'i las myur bar byed pa'o //ğŸ”½sgyu rtsal can zhes bya ba la sgyu rtsal ni gong du rnam par bshad pa'i sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: zin pa ni skyes bu'i sems 'dzin pa'i las myur bar byed pa'o // sgyu rtsal can zhes bya ba la sgyu rtsal ni gong du rnam par bshad pa'i sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The function of the mind is to hold the person's mind.ğŸ”½The word artist refers to the sixty-four arts explained above.

original: spyod pa ni sgeg pa dang bcas pas 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: spyod pa ni sgeg pa dang bcas pas 'gro ba yin la /
translated: The word conduct refers to the conduct of going about with a certain amount of charm.

original: gnas pa ni de kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni de kho na dang 'dra'o //
translated: The word pose refers to the same thing.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de 'dod pa la bskyod par mi nus pa de'i phyir drang srong 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de 'dod pa la bskyod par mi nus pa de'i phyir drang srong 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: The word sage is used because one who is free from passion by means of the supramundane path cannot be moved from that state of freedom by the passions.

original: rtsom pa'i dus la thog ma yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa yin la /
analyzed: rtsom pa'i dus la thog ma yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa yin la /
translated: The word beginningless refers to the time when the composition of the treatise began.

original: bsags pa ni goms par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa ni goms par byas pa'o //
translated: The word accumulation refers to the practice of the treatise.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The word afflictions refers to the passions.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa rgyun du skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa rgyun du skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: The word conduct refers to the continuous occurrence of the passions such as passion.

original: de khyim gyi skar khung dra ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i 'od bzang po'o //
analyzed: de khyim gyi skar khung dra ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i 'od bzang po'o //
translated: In the window-lattice of the house and so on, it is the good light of that.

original: bya ba thams cad btang ba'i blos zhes bya ba ni sems so sor bsdus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad btang ba'i blos zhes bya ba ni sems so sor bsdus par gyur pa'o //
translated: With the mind that has given up all activities means that the mind has been withdrawn.

original: yugs sa mo ni bdag po shi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yugs sa mo ni bdag po shi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: A barren woman is one whose husband has died.

original: pa'i rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni pha dang mes po brgyud pa la sogs 'ongs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni pha dang mes po brgyud pa la sogs 'ongs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Following the path means that the father, grandfather, and so on have come.

original: khyod dge ba la dad pas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyod dge ba la dad pas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because you have faith in virtue, it is said.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la mngon par dad pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la mngon par dad pas so //
translated: Because of clear faith in the Buddha's teachings.

original: khyod kyi khyim du su zhig 'ongs zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi khyim du gzhan mu stegs can 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: khyod kyi khyim du su zhig 'ongs zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi khyim du gzhan mu stegs can 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Who comes to your house? means that non-Buddhist outsiders do not enter your house.

original: gal te de dag 'jug par gyur na ni spyod pa ma yin pa byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de dag 'jug par gyur na ni spyod pa ma yin pa byed par 'gyur la /
translated: If they were to enter, they would engage in improper conduct.

original: dge slong dag 'ongs na ni de dag gi nang na 'ga' zhig ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'ongs na ni de dag gi nang na 'ga' zhig ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin la /
translated: If monks come, among them some are free from attachment.

original: 'ga' zhig ni 'tsho ba'i rgyus kyang bya ba ma yin pa byed par mi 'gyur ba'i @115a * //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni 'tsho ba'i rgyus kyang bya ba ma yin pa byed par mi 'gyur ba'i @115a * //
translated: Some people would not engage in improper actions even for the sake of their livelihood.

original: phyir dgos pa med par de slongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: phyir dgos pa med par de slongs shig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the verse says, â€œAsk for it without a reason.â€

original: rdzas kyi snying po gzhag pa'i khang pa'i lde mig dang / snying po ma yin pa'i rdzas gzhag pa'i lde mig kyog po dag go //
analyzed: rdzas kyi snying po gzhag pa'i khang pa'i lde mig dang / snying po ma yin pa'i rdzas gzhag pa'i lde mig kyog po dag go //
translated: The key to a house in which valuables are stored and the crooked key to a house in which worthless things are stored.

original: bud med kyi g-yo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bud med kyi g-yo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: â€œThe deceitfulness of women,â€ and so on.

original: gsum po de dag kyang g-yo'i rnam grangs yin la /
analyzed: gsum po de dag kyang g-yo'i rnam grangs yin la /
translated: These three are synonyms for deceit.

original: khyad par du ni sems gya gyus 'jug pa dang / zur mig gis lta ba la sogs pa ni 'dir g-yo yin la /
analyzed: khyad par du ni sems gya gyus 'jug pa dang / zur mig gis lta ba la sogs pa ni 'dir g-yo yin la /
translated: In particular, deceit is the crooked engagement of the mind, such as looking askance with sidelong glances.

analyzed: skyes bu'i sems gzung bar bya ba'i phyir g-yos 'jug pa'i ngag gi las nyid ni sgyu yin zhing /
translated: Feigning is the verbal action that engages in deceit in order to win over the minds of others.

analyzed: don de nyid la lus kyi 'gyur ba la tshul 'chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Feigning is the bodily action that is the change in bodily posture in relation to that aim.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnas bcu zhes bya ba la /

translated: â€œThe ten bases of passion,â€ and so on.

analyzed: gang dag la kos ko g-yas pa'am //

original: g-yon pa gcig kho na yang pa de dag ni kos smyung dag yin no //
analyzed: g-yon pa gcig kho na yang pa de dag ni kos smyung dag yin no //
translated: Those who have a hump on the right or left side are called â€œhumpbacked.â€

original: gang dag la kos ko med pa de dag ni kos med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la kos ko med pa de dag ni kos med pa dag yin no //
translated: Those who have no hump are called â€œwithout a hump.â€

original: gang dag gi so glang po che 'dra ba de dag ni glang chen so 'dra dag yin no //ğŸ”½rta so 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi so glang po che 'dra ba de dag ni glang chen so 'dra dag yin no // rta so 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who have tusks like an elephant are called â€œelephant-tusked.â€ğŸ”½Those who have teeth like a horse are called â€œhorse-toothed.â€

original: gang dag gi mgul ha cang ring ches pa de dag ni mgul ring ches pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi mgul ha cang ring ches pa de dag ni mgul ring ches pa'o //
translated: Those whose necks are too long are called â€œlong-necked.â€

original: gang dag la mgul med cing mgo phrag gong la 'byar ba de dag ni mjing nub dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la mgul med cing mgo phrag gong la 'byar ba de dag ni mjing nub dag yin no //
translated: Those who have no neck and whose head is joined to the shoulders are called â€œwith head joined to the shoulders.â€

original: gang dag gi mig mgo po'i mdun du gug pa nyid kyi phyir phrag pa'i phyogs dang mnyam par gyur pa de dag ni phrag mig dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gi mig mgo po'i mdun du gug pa nyid kyi phyir phrag pa'i phyogs dang mnyam par gyur pa de dag ni phrag mig dag yin no //
translated: Those whose eyes are level with the shoulders because the head is bent forward are called â€œshoulder-eyed.â€

original: yang na gang dag gi mig phrag pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa de dag ni phrag mig dag yin no //
analyzed: yang na gang dag gi mig phrag pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa de dag ni phrag mig dag yin no //
translated: Or, those who have eyes only on the shoulders are called â€œshoulder-eyed.â€

original: mi sdug par rab tu sgur ba ni ches sgur ba dag yin no //
analyzed: mi sdug par rab tu sgur ba ni ches sgur ba dag yin no //
translated: Those who are very bent are the hunchbacks.

original: gang dag gi pho mtshan chad pa de dag ni pho mtshan chad pa dag yin te /ğŸ”½skyes pa'i gci ba 'byung @117a * //
analyzed: gang dag gi pho mtshan chad pa de dag ni pho mtshan chad pa dag yin te / skyes pa'i gci ba 'byung @117a * //
translated: Those who are without a male organ are the eunuchs.

original: ba'i gnas la pho mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i gnas la pho mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: The male organ is the place where the semen is emitted.

original: gang dag gi rlig pa rlung gis rlugs par gyur pa de dag ni rlig rlugs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gi rlig pa rlung gis rlugs par gyur pa de dag ni rlig rlugs pa dag yin no //
translated: Those whose testicles are drawn up by the wind are the hermaphrodites.

original: gang dag la rlig pa'i 'bras bu gcig kho na yod pa de dag ni rlig gcig pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la rlig pa'i 'bras bu gcig kho na yod pa de dag ni rlig gcig pa dag yin no //
translated: Those who have only one testicle are the monorchids.

original: gang dag la rlig pa med pa de dag ni rlig med dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la rlig pa med pa de dag ni rlig med dag yin no //
translated: Those who have no testicles are the anorchids.

original: tshad las shin tu 'das pa dag yin pas na ha cang ring ba'o //ğŸ”½ha cang thung ba shin tu 'bol bu thung du gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: tshad las shin tu 'das pa dag yin pas na ha cang ring ba'o // ha cang thung ba shin tu 'bol bu thung du gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: Those who are too tall are the giants.ğŸ”½Those who are too short are the dwarfs.

original: skem po ni lus skams par gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: skem po ni lus skams par gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: Those who are thin are the emaciated.

original: gang dag la 'bad rtsol chung dus kyang dbugs rtseg pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa de dag ni ma 'os par ngal skyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la 'bad rtsol chung dus kyang dbugs rtseg pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa de dag ni ma 'os par ngal skyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who have faults such as panting even when making little effort are said to be â€œoverly fatigued.â€

original: ngal ba ni chad pa'i rnam grangs nyid yin pa'i phyir las cung zad kyang byed par mi bzod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngal ba ni chad pa'i rnam grangs nyid yin pa'i phyir las cung zad kyang byed par mi bzod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Fatigue is a synonym for exhaustion. Therefore, it means that one is unable to bear even a little work.

original: tsho ches pa'i tshil gyis non par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ha cang sbom por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tsho ches pa'i tshil gyis non par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ha cang sbom por gyur pa'o //
translated: It is â€œtoo fatâ€ because it is covered with too much fat.

original: sha mdog kha dog rnam bzhi dang zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dag yin te /
analyzed: sha mdog kha dog rnam bzhi dang zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dag yin te /
translated: â€œThe four colors of the fleshâ€ are blue, red, yellow, and white.

original: kha dog gi bye brag smad par bya ba gang yin pa de dag 'dir bkag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kha dog gi bye brag smad par bya ba gang yin pa de dag 'dir bkag pa yin gyi /
translated: The colors that are to be criticized are prohibited here.

original: lha rnams kyi gzugs mdzes pa lta bu dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi gzugs mdzes pa lta bu dag ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the beautiful forms of the gods.

original: gyol po ni rkang pa chag pa dag gam rkang pa sa la drud ba dag yin no //
analyzed: gyol po ni rkang pa chag pa dag gam rkang pa sa la drud ba dag yin no //
translated: â€œCripplesâ€ are those with broken legs or those who drag their legs on the ground.

original: gang dag gi rkang pa gnyis shin tu mdangs te 'gro ba de dag ni lus nyams pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gi rkang pa gnyis shin tu mdangs te 'gro ba de dag ni lus nyams pa dag yin no //
translated: Those whose two feet are very bright are those whose bodies are impaired.

original: yang na gang dag gi rkang pa gnyis gcig gi steng du gcig 'dor zhing 'gro ba de dag la lus nyams pa dag yin no //
analyzed: yang na gang dag gi rkang pa gnyis gcig gi steng du gcig 'dor zhing 'gro ba de dag la lus nyams pa dag yin no //
translated: Or, those whose two feet are placed one on top of the other as they walk are those whose bodies are impaired.

original: mdzes par bya zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus yongs su dag par ro //
analyzed: mdzes par bya zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus yongs su dag par ro //
translated: â€œBeautifulâ€ refers to the purity of the body.

original: yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni las dag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni las dag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: â€œPurityâ€ refers to the purity of action.

original: lus yongs su dag pa dang las yongs su dag pa rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa gnyi ga dag la gnyi ga sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lus yongs su dag pa dang las yongs su dag pa rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa gnyi ga dag la gnyi ga sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Both the purity of the body and the purity of action should be applied to both going forth and higher ordination.

original: yongs su dag pa dang mdzes par rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang mdzes par rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should go forth and be ordained with purity and beauty.

original: bden pa'i mtshan gang yin pa de ni bden pa'i mtshan te dngos po thams cad thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang @117b du byas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'i mtshan gang yin pa de ni bden pa'i mtshan te dngos po thams cad thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang @117b du byas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin no //
translated: The one who has the mark of truth is the Buddha, because he has comprehended all things.

original: gtam 'dres pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par mdza' ba'o //
analyzed: gtam 'dres pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par mdza' ba'o //
translated: Conversant means to be continuously friendly.

original: phebs par smra ba ni 'bring du mdza' ba'o //
analyzed: phebs par smra ba ni 'bring du mdza' ba'o //
translated: Friendly means to be friendly in the middle.

original: smos 'drin ni de yongs su bshes par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: smos 'drin ni de yongs su bshes par gyur ba'o //
translated: Acquaintance means to be well acquainted with that.

original: 'grogs bshes ni lam gcig tu 'gro ba la sogs pas shin tu mdza' ba skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'grogs bshes ni lam gcig tu 'gro ba la sogs pas shin tu mdza' ba skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: Companionship means to be very friendly through going on the same path and so on.

original: dge 'dun gyis dge 'dun bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni gsal por 'gal ba brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis dge 'dun bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni gsal por 'gal ba brjod pa yin te /
translated: The phrase â€œthe Saá¹…gha fully ordains the Saá¹…ghaâ€ clearly expresses a contradiction.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyis dge 'dun bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa de'i tshe bsnyen par rdzogs pa dag bsnyen par rdzogs pa mi skye zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa yang 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyis dge 'dun bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa de'i tshe bsnyen par rdzogs pa dag bsnyen par rdzogs pa mi skye zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa yang 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Saá¹…gha were to grant full ordination to one who is being fully ordained by the Saá¹…gha, then those who are being fully ordained would not be fully ordained, and the one who is granting full ordination would be in a state of conflict.

original: 'di ltar gang sngar 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang sngar 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this way, it is said that whoever arrives first.

original: gang 'ga' zhig sngar 'ongs par gyur pa des rnyed pa sngar blang bar bya ba yin pa las phyis bsko bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig sngar 'ongs par gyur pa des rnyed pa sngar blang bar bya ba yin pa las phyis bsko bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Whoever arrives first should take the previously obtained property, but later it should be distributed.
